instructions: Cook turkey. Soak rice paper. Fill with turkey, noodles, vegetables, and herbs. Roll tightly. Serve with peanut sauce.

name: Turkey Stew
instructions: Brown turkey. Simmer with root vegetables in stock until tender. Hearty comfort food.

name: Turkey Stir-Fry
instructions: Slice turkey thinly. Stir-fry with vegetables over high heat. Add sauce and toss until coated.

name: Turkey Stuffed Acorn Squash
instructions: Halve and roast squash. Fill with turkey-cranberry-apple mixture. Bake until heated through.

name: Turkey Stuffed Eggplant
instructions: Halve eggplants and scoop out flesh. Fill with turkey-tomato mixture. Top with feta. Bake until tender.

name: Turkey Stuffed Mushrooms
instructions: Remove mushroom stems. Fill caps with turkey mixture. Top with cheese. Bake until golden.

name: Turkey Stuffed Peppers
instructions: Hollow out peppers. Fill with turkey-rice mixture. Top with sauce and cheese. Bake until tender.

name: Turkey Stuffed Portobello Mushrooms
instructions: Remove mushroom stems. Fill caps with turkey-spinach mixture. Top with marinara and mozzarella. Bake until mushrooms are tender.

name: Turkey Stuffed Shells
instructions: Cook shells. Mix turkey with ricotta and spinach. Fill shells. Cover with sauce and cheese. Bake until bubbly.

name: Turkey Stuffed Tomatoes
instructions: Hollow out tomatoes. Fill with turkey-couscous mixture. Top with feta. Bake until tender.

name: Turkey Stuffed Zucchini
instructions: Hollow out zucchini. Fill with turkey mixture. Top with feta. Bake until zucchini is tender.

name: Turkey Stuffing Casserole
instructions: Brown turkey. Mix with bread cubes, vegetables, and stock. Bake until golden and crispy on top.

name: Turkey Sweet and Sour
instructions: Fry battered turkey. Stir-fry vegetables and pineapple. Add sweet and sour sauce. Toss with turkey.

name: Turkey Sweet Potato Hash
instructions: Cook diced sweet potatoes. Add turkey, peppers, and onions. Top with fried eggs. Breakfast hash.

name: Turkey Tabouleh Bowl
instructions: Cook turkey with spices. Prepare tabouleh with bulgur, herbs, and vegetables. Serve turkey over tabouleh.

name: Turkey Tacos
instructions: Brown turkey with taco seasoning. Fill shells with turkey, cheese, lettuce, and toppings. Serve immediately.

name: Turkey Tagine
instructions: Brown turkey with spices. Add fruit and chickpeas. Slow-cook until tender. Top with almonds.

name: Turkey Tamales
instructions: Spread masa on corn husks. Fill with turkey in green sauce. Wrap and steam for 90 minutes.

name: Turkey Teriyaki
instructions: Slice turkey. Pan-fry. Simmer in teriyaki sauce until glazed. Sprinkle with sesame seeds.

name: Turkey Tetrazzini
instructions: Cook pasta. Sauté mushrooms. Make cream sauce with sherry. Mix with turkey and pasta. Top with cheese. Bake until golden.

name: Turkey Tikka Masala
instructions: Marinate turkey in yogurt and spices. Grill. Simmer in creamy tomato-butter sauce.

name: Turkey Tom Kha
instructions: Simmer coconut milk with aromatics. Add turkey and mushrooms. Season with fish sauce and lime. Creamy Thai soup.

name: Turkey Tonnato
instructions: Poach turkey breast. Slice thinly. Top with creamy tuna-caper sauce. Serve cold as appetizer.

name: Turkey Tostadas
instructions: Spread beans on crispy shells. Top with seasoned turkey, lettuce, cheese, and crema.

name: Turkey Udon Stir-Fry
instructions: Stir-fry turkey with vegetables. Add cooked udon noodles. Season with soy, mirin, and sesame oil.

name: Turkey Vindaloo
instructions: Marinate turkey in vindaloo paste. Cook with potatoes in spicy, tangy sauce. Fiery Goan curry.

name: Turkey Waldorf Salad
instructions: Dice turkey. Mix with apples, celery, walnuts, and grapes. Dress with mayo and lemon juice.

name: Turkey Wellington
instructions: Sear turkey. Wrap in mushroom duxelles, pâté, and prosciutto. Encase in puff pastry. Bake until golden.

name: Turkey Wrap
instructions: Layer sliced turkey with vegetables and ranch on tortilla. Roll tightly and cut in half.

name: Turkey Yakitori
instructions: Thread turkey and green onions onto skewers. Grill while basting with sweet soy glaze.

name: Turkey Zucchini Boats
instructions: Hollow out zucchini halves. Fill with turkey-marinara mixture. Top with cheese. Bake until bubbly.

name: Turkish Beef Doner Kebab
instructions: Marinate beef. Stack and roast vertically. Shave thinly. Serve in pita with sauce and vegetables.

name: Turkish Beef Kofte
instructions: Mix beef with spices and herbs. Form into elongated meatballs. Grill on skewers.

name: Turkish Beef Pide
instructions: Top boat-shaped dough with spiced beef mixture. Bake until crispy. Turkish flatbread pizza.

name: Turkish Chicken Doner
instructions: Marinate chicken in yogurt and spices. Stack and roast vertically. Shave thinly and serve in lavash.

name: Turkish Chicken Kebab
instructions: Marinate chicken chunks in yogurt and spices. Thread onto skewers. Grill until charred. Serve with flatbread.

name: Turkish Chicken Kofte
instructions: Mix ground chicken with herbs and spices. Form into elongated meatballs. Grill on skewers.

name: Uruguayan Beef Chivito
instructions: Grill beef. Layer in rolls with ham, cheese, egg, bacon, and vegetables. Uruguayan mega sandwich.

name: Venezuelan Beef Pabellón
instructions: Shred braised beef. Serve with black beans, rice, and fried sweet plantains. National dish.

name: Venezuelan Beef Pabellon
instructions: Shred braised beef. Serve with beans, rice, and fried plantains. Venezuelan national dish.

name: Venezuelan Chicken Hallacas
instructions: Spread corn dough on banana leaves. Fill with seasoned chicken and toppings. Wrap and steam.

name: Vietnamese Beef Bun Bo Hue
instructions: Simmer beef and pork with lemongrass. Color with annatto. Serve over thick noodles. Spicy Hue soup.

name: Vietnamese Beef Bun Thit Nuong
instructions: Grill lemongrass beef. Serve over cold noodles with herbs and lettuce. Drizzle with nuoc cham.

name: Vietnamese Chicken Banh Mi
instructions: Marinate and grill chicken. Fill baguette with chicken, pickles, herbs, and mayo. Classic Vietnamese sandwich.

name: Vietnamese Chicken Curry
instructions: Simmer chicken with vegetables in coconut curry. French-influenced Vietnamese comfort food.

name: Vietnamese Chicken Pho
instructions: Simmer stock with spices. Poach chicken. Cook noodles. Assemble bowls with noodles, sliced chicken, and hot broth. Top with herbs.

name: Vietnamese Lemongrass Chicken
instructions: Marinate chicken in lemongrass, fish sauce, and garlic. Grill or pan-fry until caramelized and aromatic.

name: Yemeni Beef Saltah
instructions: Stew beef with vegetables. Top with fenugreek foam and raw egg. Serve bubbling hot with flatbread.

name: Zimbabwean Beef Muboora
instructions: Simmer beef with pumpkin leaves in peanut sauce. Traditional Zimbabwean greens dish.

name: Acarajé (Vegan)
instructions: Soak peas and blend with onions and garlic into paste. Form into balls and deep-fry in palm oil until golden. Serve with hot pepper sauce.

name: Ackee and Vegetables (Vegan)
instructions: Sauté peppers, onions and tomatoes with thyme and scotch bonnet. Add ackee gently and heat through. Serve with fried dumplings.

name: Adobo de Cerdo Arequipeño
instructions: Marinate pork in chicha, aji panca and oregano overnight. Brown pork with onions. Add marinade and simmer 1.5 hours until tender.

name: Adobong Baboy (Pork Adobo)
instructions: Marinate pork in soy sauce, vinegar, garlic, bay leaves and peppercorns for 1 hour. Simmer for 1 hour until tender and sauce reduces.

name: Adobong Pusit (Squid Adobo)
instructions: Simmer squid in soy sauce, vinegar, garlic, bay leaves and peppercorns for 20 minutes until tender and sauce reduces. Serve with rice.

name: Agedashi Tofu (Vegan)
instructions: Coat tofu cubes in cornstarch and deep-fry until golden. Make sauce with dashi, soy and mirin. Pour warm sauce over tofu. Garnish with grated ginger and scallions.

name: Agedashi Tofu
instructions: Coat tofu cubes in cornstarch and deep-fry until golden. Make sauce with dashi, soy and mirin. Pour warm sauce over tofu. Garnish with grated ginger and scallions.

name: Aguachile (Spicy Shrimp)
instructions: Slice raw shrimp thinly. Blend lime juice with chilies and cilantro. Pour over shrimp and marinate 10 minutes. Add sliced cucumber and onions. Serve immediately.

name: Almejas a la Marinera (Clams in Wine Sauce)
instructions: Sauté onions, add tomatoes and paprika. Add wine and reduce. Add clams and cover until they open. Garnish with parsley and serve with bread.

name: Aloo Gobi (Vegan)
instructions: Temper cumin seeds. Add onions, ginger and spices. Add potatoes and cauliflower florets. Cover and cook until tender, stirring occasionally.

name: Aloo Gobi
instructions: Temper cumin seeds. Add onions, ginger and spices. Add potatoes and cauliflower florets. Cover and cook until tender, stirring occasionally.

name: Aloo Paratha (Vegan)
instructions: Make dough with flour and water. Prepare spiced mashed potato filling. Roll out dough, stuff with potato, seal and roll flat. Cook on griddle with coconut oil until golden spots appear.

name: Aloo Paratha
instructions: Make dough with flour. Prepare spiced mashed potato filling. Roll out dough, stuff with potato, seal and roll flat. Cook on griddle with ghee until golden spots appear.

name: Ameijoas à Bulhão Pato (Clams with Coriander)
instructions: Sauté garlic in olive oil. Add clams and wine. Cover until clams open. Add cilantro and lemon juice. Serve with crusty bread to soak up juices.

name: Amritsari Fish
instructions: Make batter with flours, spices, ginger-garlic and water. Coat fish pieces in batter. Deep-fry at 350°F until golden and crispy. Serve with mint chutney.

name: Anticuchos de Cerdo
instructions: Cut pork into cubes. Marinate in aji panca, vinegar, cumin and garlic for 3 hours. Skewer and grill over high heat until charred.

name: Apple Pie (Vegan)
instructions: Slice apples and mix with sugar, cinnamon, lemon and cornstarch. Fill pie crust, cover with top crust. Bake at 375°F for 50 minutes until golden.

name: Arancini
instructions: Cook risotto and cool. Form into balls around mozzarella cubes. Coat in egg and breadcrumbs. Deep-fry at 350°F until golden. Serve with marinara sauce.

name: Arista (Tuscan Roast Pork)
instructions: Make slits in pork and insert garlic and rosemary. Rub with fennel, salt and oil. Roast at 375°F for 1.5 hours, basting with wine.

name: Arrabbiata Sauce (Vegan)
instructions: Sauté garlic and chili flakes in olive oil. Add tomatoes and simmer 25 minutes until thick. Toss with pasta and garnish with parsley.

name: Arroz con Mariscos
instructions: Sauté aji panca with peppers. Add rice and toast. Add beer and stock. When rice is half-cooked, add seafood and peas. Cook until rice is done.

name: Arroz de Marisco (Seafood Rice)
instructions: Sauté onions and tomatoes. Add rice and toast. Add wine and stock gradually. Add seafood when rice is almost done. Garnish with cilantro.

name: Atkilt Wot (Vegan)
instructions: Sauté onions with turmeric and ginger. Add chopped vegetables. Add a little water, cover and simmer for 25 minutes until vegetables are tender.

name: Atkilt Wot (Vegetable Stew)
instructions: Sauté onions with turmeric and ginger. Add chopped vegetables. Add a little water, cover and simmer for 25 minutes until vegetables are tender.

name: Aussie Pork Sausage Rolls
instructions: Mix sausage meat with onions and breadcrumbs. Roll in pastry sheets and cut into portions. Brush with egg and bake at 400°F for 25 minutes. Serve with sauce.

name: Australian Pumpkin Soup (Vegan)
instructions: Roast pumpkin. Sauté onions with curry powder. Add pumpkin and stock, simmer 20 minutes. Blend until smooth. Stir in coconut milk.

name: Baba Ganoush (Vegan)
instructions: Roast eggplant until charred and soft. Scoop out flesh and blend with tahini, lemon, garlic and cumin. Drizzle with olive oil and garnish with pomegranate seeds.

name: Baba Ganoush
instructions: Roast eggplant until charred and soft. Scoop out flesh and blend with tahini, lemon, garlic and cumin. Drizzle with olive oil and garnish with pomegranate seeds.

name: Bacalao al Pil Pil (Basque Salt Cod)
instructions: Slowly cook garlic and chilies in olive oil. Remove and add cod, shaking pan to emulsify gelatin and oil into creamy sauce. Cook 15 minutes.

name: Bacalhau à Brás (Shredded Cod with Eggs)
instructions: Shred cod and fry with matchstick potatoes and onions. Add beaten eggs and stir until just set. Garnish with olives and parsley.

name: Baccalà alla Vicentina (Salt Cod)
instructions: Layer cod with onions, anchovies and parmesan in baking dish. Pour milk and olive oil over. Bake at 325°F for 2 hours until creamy.

name: Baingan Bharta (Vegan)
instructions: Roast eggplant until charred and soft. Peel and mash. Sauté onions in oil, add ginger-garlic, tomatoes and spices. Add mashed eggplant and cook 10 minutes.

name: Baingan Bharta
instructions: Roast eggplant until charred and soft. Peel and mash. Sauté onions, add ginger-garlic, tomatoes and spices. Add mashed eggplant and cook 10 minutes.

name: Bakaliaro Skordalia (Cod with Garlic Sauce)
instructions: Make skordalia by mashing potatoes with garlic, olive oil and lemon. Coat cod in flour and fry until crispy. Serve fish with generous portion of skordalia.

name: Baked Beans (Vegan)
instructions: Soak and cook beans until tender. Mix with tomato sauce, molasses, sugar and mustard. Add onions. Bake at 325°F for 2 hours.

name: Baked Cod with Horseradish Cream
instructions: Place cod in baking dish. Mix sour cream with horseradish and spread over fish. Top with breadcrumbs and butter. Bake at 375°F for 20 minutes.

name: Baked Ziti
instructions: Mix cooked ziti with ricotta and half the marinara. Transfer to baking dish. Top with remaining sauce and mozzarella. Bake at 375°F for 30 minutes.

name: Banh Mi (Vegan)
instructions: Marinate and pan-fry tofu slices. Split baguettes and spread with sriracha. Layer with tofu, pickles, cucumber and cilantro.

name: Banh Xeo with Shrimp
instructions: Make batter with rice flour, coconut milk and turmeric. Pour into hot pan, add shrimp and bean sprouts. Fold when crispy. Wrap in lettuce with herbs.

name: Barbadian Pork Stew
instructions: Brown pork cubes. Add tomatoes, sweet potatoes, pepper and thyme. Simmer for 1.5 hours until pork is tender and stew is thick.

name: Batata Harra (Vegan)
instructions: Cube and fry potatoes until golden. Toss with minced garlic, cilantro, chili flakes, lemon juice and olive oil. Serve hot.

name: Batbout (Moroccan Pita)
instructions: Make dough with flour, yeast, oil, honey and salt. Let rise 1 hour. Divide into balls, flatten into discs. Cook on dry skillet until puffed and golden on both sides.

name: Bhindi Masala (Vegan)
instructions: Slice okra and stir-fry until crispy. Remove and sauté onions. Add tomatoes and spices. Return okra and toss until coated. Cook on low heat 10 minutes.

name: Bhindi Masala
instructions: Slice okra and stir-fry until crispy. Remove and sauté onions. Add tomatoes and spices. Return okra and toss until coated. Cook on low heat 10 minutes.

name: Bibimbap (Vegan)

ingredients.name: mixed vegetables (spinach, carrots, bean sprouts, mushrooms)

instructions: Cook rice. Blanch or sauté each vegetable separately with sesame oil. Arrange over rice in bowl. Top with gochujang and kimchi. Mix before eating.

name: Bigos (Hunter's Stew)
instructions: Layer sauerkraut, cabbage, pork, kielbasa, mushrooms and prunes. Add wine and simmer for 2 hours. Best reheated next day.

name: Bissara (Vegan)
instructions: Soak and cook fava beans until very soft. Blend with garlic, cumin and water until creamy. Drizzle with olive oil and paprika. Serve with bread.

name: Black Bean Clams
instructions: Stir-fry garlic, ginger and mashed black beans until fragrant. Add clams and rice wine. Cover and cook until clams open. Garnish with scallions.

name: Black Bean Tacos (Vegan)
instructions: Season and simmer black beans with cumin and onions. Warm tortillas. Fill with beans, avocado and cilantro. Squeeze lime over top and serve.

name: Black Bean Tacos
instructions: Season and simmer black beans with cumin. Warm tortillas. Fill with beans, avocado, cheese and cilantro. Squeeze lime over top and serve.

name: Boerewors (Pork-based)
instructions: Mix pork and beef with toasted coriander, nutmeg and vinegar. Stuff into casings in continuous spiral. Grill over coals until cooked through.

name: Boquerones en Vinagre (Marinated Anchovies)
instructions: Fillet anchovies and remove bones. Marinate in vinegar for 4 hours. Rinse and dress with olive oil, sliced garlic and parsley. Refrigerate overnight.

name: Bossam (Boiled Pork Belly)
instructions: Boil pork belly with ginger, garlic and soju for 1.5 hours until tender. Slice and serve wrapped in cabbage with shrimp sauce.

name: Bouillabaisse

ingredients.name: mixed fish (monkfish, sea bass, red mullet)

instructions: Make broth with fish bones, tomatoes, fennel, saffron and orange zest. Strain. Cook fish and shellfish in broth. Serve with rouille and crusty bread.

name: Braised Fish in Soy Sauce
instructions: Pan-fry fish until golden. Add soy sauce, sugar, star anise, ginger and wine. Braise for 15 minutes until fish absorbs flavors and sauce reduces.

name: Brandade de Morue
instructions: Poach cod with garlic. Flake fish. Mash with cooked potatoes, gradually adding olive oil and cream until creamy. Season with lemon juice. Serve warm with bread.

name: Branzino al Forno (Roasted Sea Bass)
instructions: Stuff fish with lemon and herbs. Surround with tomatoes and olives. Drizzle with wine and olive oil. Roast at 400°F for 25-30 minutes.

name: Bratwurst
instructions: Mix pork, fat and spices thoroughly. Stuff into casings and twist into links. Grill or pan-fry until cooked through and browned.

name: Brazilian Black Bean Soup (Vegan)
instructions: Cook black beans with onions, garlic, bay leaves and cumin until very soft. Blend partially. Serve with lime wedges and rice.

name: Brazilian Cheese Bread Rolls
instructions: Blend all ingredients until smooth. Pour into greased muffin tins. Bake at 375°F for 30 minutes until puffed and golden.

name: Brazilian Rice and Beans (Vegan)
instructions: Cook beans with bay leaves until tender. Sauté onions and garlic, add to beans. Cook rice separately. Serve beans over rice.

name: Briam (Greek Roasted Vegetables)
instructions: Slice all vegetables. Layer in baking dish with olive oil, oregano and salt. Bake at 375°F for 1 hour until vegetables are tender and caramelized.

name: Briam (Vegan)
instructions: Slice all vegetables. Layer in baking dish with olive oil, oregano and salt. Bake at 375°F for 1 hour until vegetables are tender and caramelized.

name: Brigadeiro
instructions: Cook condensed milk, cocoa and butter in pot, stirring constantly for 15 minutes until thick. Cool. Roll into balls and coat with chocolate sprinkles.

name: Bruschetta (Vegan)
instructions: Toast bread slices and rub with garlic. Dice tomatoes and mix with basil, olive oil and balsamic. Pile tomato mixture on toasted bread and serve immediately.

name: Bruschetta
instructions: Toast bread slices and rub with garlic. Dice tomatoes and mix with basil, olive oil and balsamic. Pile tomato mixture on toasted bread and serve immediately.

name: Buddha's Delight (Vegan)
instructions: Stir-fry tofu and vegetables with ginger. Add mushrooms and bamboo shoots. Season with soy sauce. Serve with rice.

name: Buddha's Delight
instructions: Stir-fry tofu and vegetables with ginger. Add mushrooms and bamboo shoots. Season with vegetarian oyster sauce. Serve with rice.

name: Bun Cha
instructions: Form pork patties and grill with pork belly slices. Serve over vermicelli with fish sauce dipping sauce, herbs and pickles.

name: Bun Chay (Vegan Noodle Bowl)
instructions: Cook vermicelli. Fry tofu until crispy. Assemble bowls with noodles, lettuce, bean sprouts, herbs and tofu. Top with peanuts and nuoc cham sauce.

name: Buta Kimchi
instructions: Slice pork belly thinly. Stir-fry with onions until cooked. Add kimchi, soy sauce, sake and sesame oil. Cook until combined and fragrant.

name: Buta no Shogayaki (Ginger Pork)
instructions: Slice pork thinly. Marinate in grated ginger, soy sauce, mirin and sake for 30 minutes. Stir-fry with onions until cooked through.

name: Butadon (Pork Rice Bowl)
instructions: Slice pork thinly. Simmer onions in soy, mirin and sake. Add pork and cook until done. Serve over steamed rice with cooking liquid.

name: Cacciucco (Tuscan Fish Stew)
instructions: Sauté garlic and chili. Add tomatoes and wine, simmer 30 minutes. Add seafood in order of cooking time. Serve over toasted bread.

name: Cacio e Pepe
instructions: Cook pasta until al dente, reserve pasta water. Toast black pepper in butter. Add pasta and toss with pecorino and pasta water until creamy sauce forms.

name: Caesar Salad
instructions: Make dressing with mayo, lemon, garlic and half the parmesan. Toss chopped lettuce with dressing. Top with croutons and remaining parmesan.

name: Cajun Blackened Fish
instructions: Coat fish heavily in Cajun spices and paprika. Heat cast iron skillet until smoking. Add fish and cook 3-4 minutes per side until blackened crust forms.

name: Caldeirada (Portuguese Fish Stew)
instructions: Layer potatoes, onions, peppers, tomatoes and fish in pot. Add wine and water to cover. Simmer for 30 minutes until fish is cooked and potatoes are tender.

name: Callaloo and Saltfish
instructions: Sauté onions, tomatoes and pepper. Add shredded saltfish and cook. Add callaloo and coconut milk. Simmer until greens are tender. Serve with dumplings.

name: Camarones a la Diabla (Spicy Shrimp)
instructions: Blend rehydrated chilies, chipotle, tomatoes and garlic into spicy sauce. Sauté shrimp until pink. Add sauce and simmer 5 minutes. Finish with lime juice.

name: Canh Chua Ca (Sour Fish Soup)
instructions: Simmer tamarind water with pineapple and tomatoes. Add fish pieces and cook 8 minutes. Add bean sprouts and season with fish sauce. Garnish with herbs.

name: Cantonese Lobster
instructions: Cut lobster into pieces. Stir-fry with ginger and scallions over high heat. Add soy sauce, wine and sugar. Cook until lobster is just done.

name: Cantonese Roast Pork
instructions: Marinate pork with five spice and salt. Roast at 375°F for 1 hour, basting with maltose syrup mixture until glazed.

name: Cape Malay Pork Curry
instructions: Brown pork cubes with onions and curry powder. Add tomatoes, apricots and chutney. Simmer for 1.5 hours until pork is tender and curry is thick.

name: Caprese Salad
instructions: Slice tomatoes and mozzarella. Arrange alternating slices on plate. Tuck basil leaves between. Drizzle with olive oil and balsamic vinegar. Season with salt and pepper.

name: Caramelized Fish in Clay Pot
instructions: Caramelize sugar, add fish sauce and coconut water. Add fish chunks and braise 20 minutes until sauce reduces. Season with pepper and scallions.

name: Caramelized Pork Belly (Thit Kho)
instructions: Caramelize sugar, add pork and brown. Pour in coconut water and fish sauce. Braise with eggs for 1.5 hours until tender.

name: Caramelized Tofu (Vegan)
instructions: Caramelize sugar, add soy sauce and coconut water. Add tofu cubes and braise 20 minutes until sauce reduces. Season with pepper and scallions.

name: Caribbean Callaloo (Vegan)
instructions: Sauté onions, tomatoes and pepper. Add callaloo and coconut milk. Simmer until greens are tender. Serve with rice or dumplings.

name: Caribbean Pumpkin Soup (Vegan)
instructions: Sauté onions. Add cubed pumpkin, stock, thyme and pepper. Simmer until pumpkin is soft. Blend until smooth. Stir in coconut milk.

name: Carne de Porco à Alentejana
instructions: Marinate pork in paprika, garlic and wine. Fry pork cubes until golden. Steam clams in wine. Combine pork and clams. Serve with fried potatoes and cilantro.

name: Carnitas
instructions: Cut pork into chunks. Braise in orange juice, lime, garlic and spices at 325°F for 3 hours until tender. Increase heat to crisp edges.

name: Cassoulet
instructions: Soak beans overnight. Layer beans with pork, sausage and duck in casserole. Add tomatoes and stock. Bake at 325°F for 3 hours, topping with breadcrumbs.

name: Cataplana de Marisco
instructions: Layer chorizo, peppers, tomatoes and seafood in cataplana pot. Add wine. Seal and cook over medium heat for 20 minutes. Open at table and garnish with cilantro.

name: Ceviche Peruano
instructions: Cube fish. Mix lime juice with aji amarillo. Marinate fish for 10 minutes. Add sliced onions and cilantro. Serve with boiled sweet potato and corn.

name: Ceviche
instructions: Dice fish into small cubes. Marinate in lime juice for 30 minutes until opaque. Mix with diced tomatoes, onions, jalapeños and cilantro. Serve with tostadas.

name: Cha Ca (Turmeric Fish with Dill)
instructions: Marinate fish in turmeric and fish sauce. Pan-fry fish with dill and scallions. Serve over vermicelli with peanuts and nuoc cham sauce.

name: Chana Masala (Vegan)
instructions: Sauté onions in coconut oil until golden. Add ginger-garlic and spices. Add tomatoes and cook until oil separates. Add chickpeas and simmer 20 minutes. Garnish with coriander.

name: Chana Masala
instructions: Sauté onions until golden. Add ginger-garlic and spices. Add tomatoes and cook until oil separates. Add chickpeas and simmer 20 minutes. Garnish with coriander.

name: Chancho al Horno
instructions: Marinate pork leg in beer, soy sauce, garlic, cumin and rosemary for 8 hours. Roast at 350°F for 3.5 hours until crispy outside and tender inside.

name: Char Siu Pork
instructions: Marinate pork in mixture of all sauces and spices for 4 hours. Roast at 375°F for 45 minutes, basting frequently until caramelized.

name: Cheese Enchiladas
instructions: Dip tortillas in sauce, fill with cheese and onions. Roll and place in baking dish. Top with remaining sauce and cheese. Bake at 375°F for 25 minutes.

name: Chicharron Colombiano
instructions: Cut pork into chunks. Boil with salt and baking soda until water evaporates. Continue cooking in own fat until crispy. Serve with arepa and lime.

name: Chicharron de Cerdo
instructions: Cut pork into chunks. Marinate with orange, garlic and cumin. Boil until water evaporates, then fry in own fat until crispy. Serve with sweet potato and corn.

name: Chile Verde
instructions: Roast tomatillos and peppers, blend with cilantro and cumin. Brown pork cubes. Add sauce and simmer for 2 hours until tender.

name: Chiles Rellenos
instructions: Roast and peel poblanos. Stuff with cheese. Dip in egg batter and fry until golden. Serve with warm tomato sauce.

name: Chili Crab
instructions: Cut crab into pieces. Stir-fry with ginger and garlic. Add tomato and chili sauce. Simmer 10 minutes. Drizzle beaten eggs and stir to create ribbons.

name: Chinese Bok Choy Stir-Fry (Vegan)
instructions: Stir-fry mushrooms, garlic and ginger over high heat. Add bok choy and cook until wilted. Season with soy sauce and sesame oil.

name: Chinese Bok Choy Stir-Fry
instructions: Stir-fry mushrooms, garlic and ginger over high heat. Add bok choy and cook until wilted. Season with soy sauce and sesame oil.

name: Chinese Broccoli with Garlic (Vegan)
instructions: Blanch Chinese broccoli until tender-crisp. Stir-fry garlic and ginger. Add broccoli and soy sauce. Toss quickly and finish with sesame oil.

name: Chinese Broccoli with Oyster Sauce
instructions: Blanch Chinese broccoli until tender-crisp. Stir-fry garlic and ginger. Add broccoli and oyster sauce. Toss quickly and finish with sesame oil.

name: Chinese Eggplant with Garlic Sauce (Vegan)
instructions: Fry eggplant until soft. Make sauce with garlic, ginger, soy, vinegar, sugar and chili paste. Toss eggplant in sauce until well coated.

name: Chinese Eggplant with Garlic Sauce
instructions: Fry eggplant until soft. Make sauce with garlic, ginger, soy, vinegar, sugar and chili paste. Toss eggplant in sauce until well coated.

name: Chinese Hot and Sour Soup (Vegan)
instructions: Simmer vegetables in vegetable broth. Add vinegar, soy sauce and white pepper. Thicken with cornstarch slurry. Serve hot.

name: Chinese Hot and Sour Soup
instructions: Simmer vegetables in broth. Add vinegar, soy sauce and white pepper. Drizzle beaten eggs while stirring. Thicken with cornstarch slurry.

name: Chipirones en su Tinta (Squid in Ink Sauce)
instructions: Sauté onions and garlic. Add tomatoes and wine. Add squid and simmer 30 minutes. Stir in ink and cook until sauce is dark and thick.

name: Chirashi Sushi Bowl
instructions: Season rice with vinegar and sugar. Arrange sliced sashimi, egg, cucumber and avocado over rice. Garnish with nori strips and serve with soy sauce.

name: Chorizo al Vino
instructions: Slice chorizo and brown in pan. Add onions and garlic, cook until soft. Pour in red wine and simmer for 20 minutes until reduced.

name: Chupe de Camarones (Shrimp Chowder)
instructions: Simmer shrimp shells for stock. Cook potatoes and corn in stock. Add milk, shrimp and aji panca. Poach eggs in soup. Add cheese before serving.

name: Clams with Basil
instructions: Stir-fry garlic and chilies. Add clams and a splash of water. Cover until clams open. Toss with basil, fish sauce and lime juice.

name: Cochinillo Asado (Roast Suckling Pig)
instructions: Rub pig with salt and lard. Roast at 350°F for 2 hours, basting with wine. Increase heat to crisp skin in final 20 minutes.

name: Cochinita Pibil
instructions: Marinate pork in achiote, orange and lime juice overnight. Wrap in banana leaves and slow-roast at 275°F for 5 hours. Shred and serve with pickled onions.

name: Cocktail de Camarón (Shrimp Cocktail)
instructions: Mix tomato juice, ketchup, lime and hot sauce. Add shrimp and diced avocado. Chill. Serve in glasses with cilantro, lime and saltine crackers.

name: Coconut Chutney
instructions: Blend coconut with chilies, ginger and chana dal into smooth paste. Temper mustard seeds and curry leaves in oil. Mix into chutney. Serve with dosa or idli.

name: Coconut Mussel Soup
instructions: Simmer coconut milk with lemongrass and galangal. Add cleaned mussels and cook until they open. Season with lime juice and add Thai basil.

name: Coleslaw (Vegan)
instructions: Shred cabbage and carrots. Mix vegan mayo, vinegar and sugar for dressing. Toss vegetables with dressing. Chill for at least 1 hour before serving.

name: Coleslaw
instructions: Shred cabbage and carrots. Mix mayo, vinegar and sugar for dressing. Toss vegetables with dressing. Chill for at least 1 hour before serving.

name: Com Tam (Vegan Broken Rice)
instructions: Cook broken rice. Marinate tofu in lemongrass and soy, then grill. Serve rice with grilled tofu, pickled vegetables and cucumber.

name: Conch Fritters
instructions: Chop conch finely. Mix with flour, baking powder, diced peppers and onions. Form into balls and deep-fry until golden. Serve with spicy mayo.

name: Coquilles Saint-Jacques
instructions: Poach scallops in wine. Sauté mushrooms. Make cream sauce with cooking liquid. Arrange in shells, top with cheese and breadcrumbs. Broil until golden.

name: Corn Chowder (Vegan)
instructions: Sauté onions. Add potatoes and stock, simmer until tender. Add corn and coconut milk. Blend partially for creamy texture. Season and serve.

name: Corn Chowder
instructions: Sauté onions in butter. Add potatoes and stock, simmer until tender. Add corn and cream. Blend partially for creamy texture. Season and serve.

name: Costelinha ao Molho Barbecue
instructions: Marinate ribs in BBQ sauce mixed with guarana, garlic and cumin for 4 hours. Grill over medium heat, basting frequently until caramelized.

name: Cotechino
instructions: Grind pork, skin and fat together. Season with garlic and spices. Stuff into casing and poach for 2 hours. Slice and serve hot.

name: Country Style Pork Ribs
instructions: Brown ribs in skillet. Transfer to slow cooker with onions, BBQ sauce, vinegar and sugar. Cook on low for 6-8 hours until fall-apart tender.

name: Crab and Callaloo
instructions: Clean and crack crab. Sauté onions, garlic and pepper. Add crab and brown. Add callaloo and coconut milk. Simmer 20 minutes until crab is cooked.

name: Crab Cakes
instructions: Mix crab with mayo, egg, breadcrumbs, Old Bay and mustard. Form into patties. Pan-fry for 4 minutes per side until golden. Serve with remoulade sauce.

name: Crab Fried Rice
instructions: Stir-fry onions and scrambled eggs. Add cold cooked rice and break up lumps. Add crab meat and fish sauce. Toss until heated through. Serve with lime wedges.

name: Crab Masala
instructions: Grind coconut with chilies and spices. Clean and crack crab. Fry with onions and curry leaves. Add spice paste and tamarind. Cook until crab is done.

name: Crispy Fried Tilapia
instructions: Score tilapia, season with salt and pepper. Coat in flour and deep-fry until golden and crispy. Serve with spiced vinegar dipping sauce.

name: Crispy Pork Belly
instructions: Score pork skin, rub with salt and vinegar. Roast at 325°F for 1 hour, then increase to 450°F for 30 minutes until skin crackles.

name: Crispy Whole Fish
instructions: Score fish, coat in cornstarch and deep-fry until crispy. Make sweet-sour sauce with soy, vinegar, sugar and ginger. Pour over fish and serve immediately.

name: Croque Monsieur
instructions: Make béchamel sauce with butter, flour and milk. Spread mustard on bread, add cheese, top with béchamel. Broil until golden and bubbly.

name: Cuban Roast Pork (Lechon Asado)
instructions: Make mojo with orange juice, garlic, cumin and oregano. Marinate pork overnight. Roast at 325°F for 4 hours, basting frequently until tender.

name: Cuban Sandwich Filling
instructions: Layer Cuban bread with mustard, roast pork, ham, cheese and pickles. Press in sandwich press or heavy skillet until cheese melts and bread is crispy.

name: Currywurst
instructions: Grill or fry bratwurst. Slice into pieces. Make sauce with ketchup, curry powder and paprika. Pour over sausage and sprinkle with more curry powder.

name: Dal Makhani
instructions: Soak and cook lentils and beans until very soft. Make tomato-spice gravy with butter. Add lentils and simmer for 30 minutes. Finish with cream.

name: Dal Tadka (Vegan)
instructions: Cook lentils until soft and mushy. Make tadka with oil, cumin, garlic and chilies. Pour over dal. Add tomatoes and coriander. Simmer 5 minutes.

name: Dal Tadka
instructions: Cook lentils until soft and mushy. Make tadka with ghee, cumin, garlic and chilies. Pour over dal. Add tomatoes and coriander. Simmer 5 minutes.

name: Damper Bread (Vegan)
instructions: Mix flour, baking powder and salt. Add water and oil to form dough. Shape into round loaf. Bake at 375°F for 35 minutes until golden.

name: Dan Dan Noodles (Vegan)
instructions: Mix tahini, soy sauce, chili oil and garlic into sauce. Cook noodles and toss with sauce. Top with scallions and toasted sichuan peppercorns.

name: Dan Dan Noodles (Vegetarian)
instructions: Mix tahini, soy sauce, chili oil and garlic into sauce. Cook noodles and toss with sauce. Top with scallions and toasted sichuan peppercorns.

name: Danish Rye Bread (Vegan)
instructions: Mix all ingredients and let rise 2 hours. Shape into loaf. Bake at 350°F for 1.5 hours. Cool completely before slicing.

name: Doenjang Jjigae (Vegan)
instructions: Make broth with doenjang and gochugaru. Add vegetables and tofu. Simmer 15 minutes. Serve with rice.

name: Dolmades (Stuffed Grape Leaves)
instructions: Mix cooked rice with herbs and onions. Wrap in grape leaves. Layer in pot, cover with water, lemon and oil. Simmer for 45 minutes.

name: Dominican Chicharron
instructions: Cut pork belly into chunks. Marinate with lime, garlic, oregano and salt. Boil until water evaporates, then fry in own fat until crispy.

name: Dosa with Potato Masala
instructions: Make potato filling with mustard seeds, curry leaves, turmeric and onions. Spread dosa batter thinly on hot griddle. Fill with potato masala and fold.

name: Drunken Prawns
instructions: Marinate prawns in wine, ginger, garlic, soy and sugar for 30 minutes. Quick-boil prawns in marinade for 3-4 minutes until pink.

name: Dwaeji Gukbap (Pork Soup)
instructions: Boil pork and liver with garlic and ginger for 2 hours until tender. Slice and serve in broth over rice with green onions.

name: Edamame (Vegan)
instructions: Boil edamame in salted water for 5-7 minutes until tender. Drain and toss with coarse salt and a drizzle of sesame oil. Serve warm or at room temperature.

name: Edamame
instructions: Boil edamame in salted water for 5-7 minutes until tender. Drain and toss with coarse salt and a drizzle of sesame oil. Serve warm or at room temperature.

name: Eggplant Parmigiana
instructions: Slice and salt eggplant, let drain 30 minutes. Fry in olive oil until golden. Layer with tomato sauce and cheeses. Bake at 375°F for 40 minutes until bubbly.

name: Eisbein (Pickled Pork Knuckle)
instructions: Boil pork knuckles with bay leaves and peppercorns for 2 hours until tender. Serve with warm sauerkraut and mustard.

name: Elote (Mexican Street Corn)
instructions: Grill corn until charred. Brush with mayo. Roll in crumbled cotija cheese. Sprinkle with chili powder and cilantro. Squeeze lime over top.

name: Escalivada (Vegan)
instructions: Roast all vegetables until charred and soft. Peel and slice. Dress with olive oil and minced garlic. Serve at room temperature.

name: Escovitch Fish (Jamaican)
instructions: Fry whole fish until crispy. Make pickled vegetable sauce with vinegar, julienned vegetables, pepper and allspice. Pour hot sauce over fish.

name: Espinacas con Garbanzos (Vegan)
instructions: Sauté garlic in olive oil. Add cumin and paprika. Add spinach and cook until wilted. Add chickpeas and simmer 10 minutes. Serve with crusty bread.

name: Espinacas con Garbanzos
instructions: Sauté garlic in olive oil. Add cumin and paprika. Add spinach and cook until wilted. Add chickpeas and simmer 10 minutes. Serve with crusty bread.

name: Ethiopian Lentil Stew (Vegan)
instructions: Sauté onions, garlic and ginger. Add turmeric and coriander. Add lentils and water. Simmer for 30 minutes until lentils are soft and creamy.

name: Fabada Asturiana
instructions: Soak beans overnight. Cook with pork, chorizo and morcilla for 2.5 hours. Season with saffron and paprika until creamy.

name: Falafel (Vegan)
instructions: Soak chickpeas overnight. Blend with herbs, onions, garlic and spices. Form into balls. Deep-fry at 350°F for 4-5 minutes until golden. Serve in pita with tahini sauce.

name: Falafel
instructions: Soak chickpeas overnight. Blend with herbs, onions, garlic and spices. Form into balls. Deep-fry at 350°F for 4-5 minutes until golden. Serve in pita with tahini sauce.

name: Farofa (Vegan)
instructions: Sauté onions and garlic in oil. Add cassava flour and toast, stirring constantly. Add olives and raisins. Serve as side dish.

name: Fasolada (Greek Bean Soup)
instructions: Soak and cook beans. Add vegetables, tomatoes and olive oil. Simmer for 1 hour until thick and creamy. Finish with lemon juice.

name: Fasolada (Vegan)
instructions: Soak and cook beans. Add vegetables, tomatoes and olive oil. Simmer for 1 hour until thick and creamy. Finish with lemon juice.

name: Fatayer bi Sabanekh (Spinach Pies)
instructions: Sauté spinach with onions, lemon and sumac. Roll dough into circles. Add filling and fold into triangles. Bake at 400°F for 15 minutes until golden.

name: Fattoush (Vegan)
instructions: Toast pita until crispy. Toss chopped vegetables with sumac. Make dressing with pomegranate molasses and olive oil. Add pita pieces just before serving.

name: Fattoush (Vegan)
instructions: Toast pita until crispy. Toss chopped vegetables with sumac. Make dressing with pomegranate molasses and olive oil. Add pita pieces just before serving.

name: Fattoush Salad
instructions: Toast pita until crispy and break into pieces. Toss with chopped vegetables, sumac, lemon juice and olive oil. Serve immediately while pita is still crispy.

name: Fattoush
instructions: Toast pita until crispy. Toss chopped vegetables with sumac. Make dressing with pomegranate molasses and olive oil. Add pita pieces just before serving.

name: Febras de Porco
instructions: Marinate pork slices in wine, garlic, bay leaves and paprika for 3 hours. Pan-fry until cooked through. Serve with rice and salad.

name: Feijoada Vegetariana (Vegan)
instructions: Cook black beans with vegetables, smoked paprika and bay leaves for 2 hours. Serve with white rice, orange slices and sautéed collard greens.

name: Feijoada Vegetariana
instructions: Cook black beans with vegetables, smoked paprika and bay leaves for 2 hours. Serve with white rice, orange slices and sautéed collard greens.

name: Feijoada
instructions: Soak beans overnight. Cook with all pork cuts, garlic and bay leaves for 2.5 hours. Serve with rice, collard greens, orange slices and farofa.

name: Filetes de Pescada (Hake Fillets)
instructions: Coat hake in flour, then beaten egg. Pan-fry in olive oil until golden on both sides. Serve with white rice and lemon wedges.

name: Finnish Berry Soup (Vegan)
instructions: Simmer berries with water, sugar and cinnamon for 20 minutes. Thicken with potato starch. Serve warm or cold.

name: Fish and Chips
instructions: Make beer batter with flour and beer. Coat fish and deep-fry at 375°F for 6-8 minutes. Fry potato chips separately. Serve with lemon and tartar sauce.

name: Fish Congee
instructions: Simmer rice in water for 1 hour until thick porridge forms. Add sliced fish and ginger, cook 5 minutes. Top with scallions, soy sauce and sesame oil.

name: Fish Curry (Goan Style)
instructions: Fry spice paste with onions. Add tomatoes and tamarind. Add coconut milk and bring to boil. Add fish and simmer 10 minutes until cooked.

name: Fish Jeon (Pan-Fried Fish)
instructions: Season fish and coat in flour, then beaten egg. Pan-fry in oil until golden on both sides. Cut into pieces and serve with soy dipping sauce.

name: Fish Moilee
instructions: Sauté ginger, green chilies and curry leaves. Add turmeric and coconut milk. Bring to gentle simmer. Add fish and cook for 8-10 minutes. Serve with rice.

name: Fish Pho
instructions: Simmer broth with ginger, star anise and fish sauce. Cook noodles separately. Add fish slices to hot broth for 3 minutes. Assemble with noodles and fresh herbs.

name: Fish Rundown (Jamaican)
instructions: Reduce coconut milk until it separates. Add onions, tomatoes, pepper and thyme. Add fish and simmer 15 minutes. Serve with boiled dumplings.

name: Fish Tacos
instructions: Season fish with cumin and grill or pan-fry. Warm tortillas. Fill with fish, cabbage slaw, crema and pico de gallo. Serve with lime wedges.

name: Fish Tikka
instructions: Marinate fish in yogurt, tikka masala, ginger-garlic and lemon for 1 hour. Skewer and grill for 8-10 minutes, turning once. Serve with mint chutney.

name: Focaccia Bread (Vegan)
instructions: Make dough with flour, yeast, water and olive oil. Let rise. Press into oiled pan, dimple surface. Top with rosemary, tomatoes and salt. Bake at 425°F for 25 minutes.

name: Focaccia Bread
instructions: Make dough with flour, yeast, water and olive oil. Let rise. Press into oiled pan, dimple surface. Top with rosemary, tomatoes and salt. Bake at 425°F for 25 minutes.

name: French Lentil Salad (Vegan)
instructions: Cook lentils with carrots and celery until tender. Drain. Make vinaigrette with mustard, vinegar and oil. Toss lentils with vinaigrette and diced shallots.

name: French Lentil Salad
instructions: Cook lentils with carrots and celery until tender. Drain. Make vinaigrette with mustard, vinegar and oil. Toss lentils with vinaigrette and diced shallots.

name: French Onion Soup (Vegan)
instructions: Caramelize onions slowly in oil for 45 minutes. Add wine and stock, simmer 30 minutes. Pour into bowls, top with toasted bread.

name: French Onion Soup
instructions: Caramelize onions slowly in butter for 45 minutes. Add wine and stock, simmer 30 minutes. Pour into bowls, top with toasted bread and cheese. Broil until bubbly.

name: Fried Catfish
instructions: Marinate catfish in buttermilk. Mix cornmeal, flour and Cajun seasoning. Coat fish and deep-fry at 350°F for 6-8 minutes until golden. Serve with hush puppies.

name: Fried Pork Chops
instructions: Marinate chops in buttermilk. Mix flour with spices. Dip chops in egg, then seasoned flour. Fry in hot oil for 4-5 minutes per side until golden.

name: Fried Tofu with Salt and Pepper (Vegan)
instructions: Coat tofu cubes in cornstarch, salt and pepper. Deep-fry until crispy. Toss with fried garlic and chilies. Serve immediately.

name: Fried Tofu with Salt and Pepper
instructions: Coat tofu cubes in cornstarch, salt and pepper. Deep-fry until crispy. Toss with fried garlic and chilies. Serve immediately.

name: Fritanga
instructions: Grill or fry all pork cuts until crispy. Fry potatoes and plantains separately. Serve mixed platter with aji sauce and arepa.

name: Fritto Misto (Mixed Fried Seafood)
instructions: Coat all seafood lightly in flour. Deep-fry at 375°F until golden and crispy, about 3-4 minutes. Drain and serve immediately with lemon wedges.

name: Ful Medames (Vegan)
instructions: Simmer fava beans until tender. Mash roughly with garlic, lemon juice and cumin. Drizzle with olive oil. Serve with pita bread.

name: Ful Medames
instructions: Simmer fava beans until tender. Mash roughly with garlic, lemon juice and cumin. Drizzle with olive oil. Serve with hard-boiled eggs and pita bread.

name: Gado-Gado (Vegan)
instructions: Blanch vegetables. Fry tofu and tempeh. Make peanut sauce with peanut butter, lime and chili. Arrange vegetables and proteins, pour sauce over.

name: Gambas al Ajillo (Garlic Shrimp)
instructions: Heat olive oil with sliced garlic and chili until fragrant. Add shrimp and cook 3-4 minutes until pink. Garnish with parsley and serve in clay dish with bread.

name: Gamjatang (Pork Spine Stew)
instructions: Boil pork bones for 1 hour, skim foam. Add potatoes, gochugaru, garlic and perilla powder. Simmer 40 minutes. Add leaves before serving.

name: Ganjang Gejang (Soy Marinated Crab)
instructions: Clean crabs. Simmer soy sauce with mirin, garlic, ginger and kelp. Cool completely. Pour over crabs and marinate for 3 days in refrigerator.

name: Garides Saganaki (Shrimp in Tomato Sauce)
instructions: Make tomato sauce with garlic. Add shrimp and ouzo, cook 5 minutes. Top with crumbled feta and bake at 400°F for 10 minutes. Garnish with parsley.

name: Gazpacho (Vegan)
instructions: Blend all vegetables with bread, olive oil and vinegar until smooth. Chill for at least 4 hours. Serve cold with diced vegetable garnish.

name: Gazpacho
instructions: Blend all vegetables with bread, olive oil and vinegar until smooth. Chill for at least 4 hours. Serve cold with diced vegetable garnish.

name: German Potato Salad (Vegan)
instructions: Boil potatoes, slice while warm. Mix with onions. Make dressing with vinegar, oil, mustard and warm stock. Pour over potatoes while hot.

name: Gigantes Plaki (Vegan)
instructions: Soak and cook beans until tender. Make tomato sauce with onions and garlic. Combine beans with sauce. Bake at 350°F for 30 minutes. Garnish with parsley.

name: Gigantes Plaki
instructions: Soak and cook beans until tender. Make tomato sauce with onions and garlic. Combine beans with sauce. Bake at 350°F for 30 minutes. Garnish with parsley.

name: Ginataang Hipon (Shrimp in Coconut Milk)
instructions: Simmer coconut milk with ginger. Add squash and cook until tender. Add shrimp and string beans. Season with fish sauce and cook until shrimp are pink.

name: Glass Noodle Salad with Seafood
instructions: Boil seafood and glass noodles separately. Drain and cool. Toss with lime juice, fish sauce, herbs and peanuts. Serve at room temperature.

name: Gnocchi with Sage Butter
instructions: Boil gnocchi until they float. Brown butter with sage leaves and garlic. Toss gnocchi in sage butter. Serve with generous parmesan and cracked black pepper.

name: Gobi Manchurian (Vegan)
instructions: Coat cauliflower florets in cornflour batter and deep-fry. Make Indo-Chinese sauce with soy, ginger-garlic and chilies. Toss fried cauliflower in sauce.

name: Gobi Manchurian
instructions: Coat cauliflower florets in cornflour batter and deep-fry. Make Indo-Chinese sauce with soy, ginger-garlic and chilies. Toss fried cauliflower in sauce.

name: Golonka (Pork Knuckle)
instructions: Boil pork knuckles with vegetables and spices for 2 hours until tender. Brush with beer and roast at 400°F for 30 minutes until crispy. Serve with mustard.

name: Gomen (Ethiopian Collard Greens)
instructions: Sauté onions, garlic and ginger. Add turmeric. Add chopped collard greens and a little water. Cover and simmer for 20 minutes until tender.

name: Gomen (Vegan)
instructions: Sauté onions, garlic and ginger. Add turmeric. Add chopped collard greens and a little water. Cover and simmer for 20 minutes until tender.

name: Gratin Dauphinois
instructions: Slice potatoes thinly. Layer in buttered baking dish rubbed with garlic. Pour cream-milk mixture over, top with cheese. Bake at 350°F for 1 hour until golden.

name: Gravlax (Cured Salmon)
instructions: Mix salt, sugar, dill and pepper. Coat salmon and wrap tightly. Refrigerate for 48 hours, flipping once. Slice thin and serve with mustard sauce.

name: Greek Salad (Vegan)
instructions: Dice tomatoes and cucumber. Add sliced onions and olives. Dress with olive oil, oregano and salt. Serve immediately.

name: Greek Salad
instructions: Dice tomatoes and cucumber. Add sliced onions, olives and cubed feta. Dress with olive oil, oregano and salt. Serve immediately.

name: Green Curry with Fish
instructions: Fry curry paste until fragrant. Add coconut milk and bring to boil. Add eggplant and fish chunks. Simmer 10 minutes. Add basil and fish sauce.

name: Green Curry with Vegetables (Vegan)
instructions: Fry curry paste in coconut cream until fragrant. Add coconut milk and bring to boil. Add vegetables and simmer until tender. Add basil and sugar.

name: Green Curry with Vegetables
instructions: Fry curry paste in coconut cream until fragrant. Add coconut milk and bring to boil. Add vegetables and simmer until tender. Add basil and sugar.

name: Grilled Bangus (Milkfish)
instructions: Marinate milkfish in vinegar, soy sauce, garlic and pepper for 2 hours. Grill over charcoal until skin is crispy and meat is cooked through.

name: Grilled Barramundi
instructions: Season barramundi with salt and pepper. Grill skin-side down for 5 minutes, flip for 2 minutes. Top with herb butter and lemon juice.

name: Grilled Cheese Sandwich
instructions: Butter bread on both sides. Layer cheese between bread slices. Grill in pan over medium heat until golden and cheese melts, about 3 minutes per side.

name: Grilled Fish with Tahini Sauce
instructions: Season fish with cumin and grill for 8 minutes per side. Make tahini sauce with tahini, lemon, garlic and water. Drizzle over fish and garnish with parsley.

name: Grilled Lemongrass Shrimp
instructions: Marinate shrimp in minced lemongrass, garlic, fish sauce and sugar for 2 hours. Skewer and grill over high heat 3 minutes per side. Serve with lime.

name: Grilled Mackerel (Godeungeo Gui)
instructions: Score mackerel and salt generously. Grill until skin is crispy and meat is cooked. Serve with soy-garlic dipping sauce and rice.

name: Grilled Mackerel (Saba Shioyaki)
instructions: Salt mackerel fillets generously and let sit 30 minutes. Grill skin-side down for 8 minutes, flip for 2 minutes. Serve with grated daikon and lemon.

name: Grilled Octopus
instructions: Boil octopus for 45 minutes until tender. Cut into pieces. Marinate in olive oil, vinegar and oregano. Grill over high heat until charred. Serve with lemon.

name: Grilled Prawns with Seafood Sauce
instructions: Butterfly prawns and grill 3 minutes per side. Make dipping sauce with lime juice, fish sauce, chilies, garlic and sugar. Serve prawns with sauce.

name: Grilled Sardines with Ladolemono
instructions: Grill sardines for 3-4 minutes per side. Make ladolemono sauce by whisking lemon juice, olive oil, oregano and minced garlic. Drizzle over sardines.

name: Grilled Swordfish with Salmoriglio
instructions: Grill swordfish steaks for 4-5 minutes per side. Make sauce with lemon juice, olive oil, oregano and minced garlic. Pour over fish.

name: Guacamole
instructions: Mash avocados with lime juice. Mix in diced tomatoes, onions, jalapeño and cilantro. Season with salt. Serve with tortilla chips.

name: Gyoza (Pork Dumplings)
instructions: Mix pork with minced cabbage, chives, ginger, soy and sesame oil. Fill gyoza wrappers. Pan-fry until bottoms are crispy, add water and steam.

name: Haitian Griot
instructions: Marinate pork cubes in citrus, peppers and herbs for 4 hours. Boil until tender, then deep-fry until crispy. Serve with pikliz.

name: Halloumi Salad
instructions: Grill halloumi slices until golden. Arrange greens with watermelon cubes. Top with warm halloumi, torn mint, lemon juice and olive oil.

name: Ham and Bean Soup
instructions: Soak beans overnight. Simmer ham hock with vegetables and bay leaves for 2 hours. Remove hock, shred meat and return to soup. Simmer until beans are tender.

name: Hamachi Kama (Yellowtail Collar)
instructions: Salt yellowtail collar and grill for 15-20 minutes until skin is crispy and meat is cooked through. Serve with grated daikon, ponzu and lemon.

name: Harira Soup (Vegan)
instructions: Simmer lentils, chickpeas, vegetables and spices in stock for 1 hour. Add chopped cilantro and lemon juice. Serve with dates and bread.

name: Honey Garlic Pork Chops
instructions: Pan-fry pork chops until golden. Make sauce with honey, minced garlic, soy sauce and vinegar. Pour over chops and simmer 5 minutes.

name: Horiatiki (Greek Village Salad Vegan)
instructions: Chop all vegetables into large chunks. Add olives. Dress generously with olive oil and oregano. Serve at room temperature.

name: Huevos Rancheros
instructions: Fry eggs sunny-side up. Warm tortillas and spread with refried beans. Top with eggs and ranchero sauce. Garnish with cheese and avocado.

name: Humba
instructions: Brown pork belly. Add soy sauce, black beans, sugar and bay leaves. Simmer with banana blossoms for 1.5 hours until tender and sweet.

name: Hummus (Vegan)
instructions: Blend chickpeas with tahini, lemon juice, garlic and cumin until smooth. Adjust consistency with water. Drizzle with olive oil and serve with pita bread.

name: Hummus
instructions: Blend chickpeas with tahini, lemon juice, garlic and cumin until smooth. Adjust consistency with water. Drizzle with olive oil and serve with pita bread.

name: Hurka (Pork Liver Sausage)
instructions: Cook liver, pork, rice and onions until tender. Grind together with marjoram. Stuff into casings. Poach for 30 minutes. Slice and pan-fry to serve.

name: Injera Bread (Vegan)
instructions: Mix teff flour with water and salt. Let ferment at room temperature for 2-3 days. Pour thin layer on hot griddle and cook like crepe.

name: Insalata di Mare (Seafood Salad)
instructions: Boil all seafood separately until tender. Cool and cut into bite-size pieces. Toss with celery, lemon, olive oil, garlic and parsley. Chill before serving.

name: Jalea (Fried Seafood)
instructions: Coat seafood in flour-cornstarch mixture. Deep-fry at 375°F until crispy. Serve piled high with lime-marinated red onion salsa on top.

name: Jamaican Jerk Pork
instructions: Blend peppers, allspice, thyme, ginger and lime into paste. Rub on pork and marinate overnight. Grill over pimento wood or smoke at 250°F for 4 hours.

name: Jamaican Rice and Peas (Vegan)
instructions: Cook beans until tender. Add rice, coconut milk, thyme and whole scotch bonnet. Cook until rice is tender. Remove pepper before serving.

name: Japchae (Vegan)
instructions: Cook noodles until tender. Stir-fry vegetables. Toss noodles with vegetables, soy sauce, sesame oil and sugar. Garnish with sesame seeds.

name: Jeyuk Bokkeum (Spicy Pork Stir-Fry)
instructions: Marinate sliced pork in gochujang, gochugaru and soy sauce for 1 hour. Stir-fry with onions and cabbage over high heat.

name: Kadai Paneer
instructions: Sauté bell peppers and onions. Add tomatoes and kadai masala. Cook until thick gravy forms. Add paneer cubes and simmer 5 minutes. Garnish with coriander.

name: Kakuni (Braised Pork Belly)
instructions: Cut pork into cubes and blanch. Braise in soy, sake, mirin, sugar and ginger for 2.5 hours until meltingly tender. Garnish with onions.

name: Kalamarakia Tiganita (Fried Calamari)
instructions: Coat squid rings in seasoned flour. Deep-fry at 375°F for 2-3 minutes until golden and crispy. Drain and serve immediately with lemon wedges.

name: Kassler Rippchen
instructions: Layer sauerkraut with onions and juniper in pot. Top with smoked chops and wine. Braise at 325°F for 1.5 hours until tender.

name: Katsudon
instructions: Prepare tonkatsu and slice. Simmer onions in dashi, soy and mirin. Add pork and beaten eggs. Cook until eggs set. Serve over rice.

name: Kielbasa in Beer
instructions: Slice kielbasa and brown. Add sliced onions and cook until soft. Pour in beer, mustard and sugar. Simmer 20 minutes until sauce thickens.

name: Kimbap (Vegan)
instructions: Season rice with sesame oil and salt. Prepare vegetables. Spread rice on seaweed, layer with vegetables. Roll tightly and slice.

name: Kimchi Jjigae (Vegan)
instructions: Stir-fry kimchi. Add vegetable stock, gochugaru and gochujang. Add tofu and mushrooms. Simmer for 20 minutes. Top with green onions.

name: Kimchi Jjigae with Pork
instructions: Stir-fry sliced pork with kimchi. Add water, gochugaru and gochujang. Simmer with tofu for 20 minutes. Top with green onions.

name: Kinilaw (Filipino Ceviche)
instructions: Cube fresh fish. Marinate in vinegar, calamansi, grated ginger, onions and chilies for 30 minutes. Serve immediately as appetizer.

name: Kolbász (Hungarian Sausage)
instructions: Mix pork, fat, paprika, garlic and caraway thoroughly. Stuff into casings. Smoke at low temperature for 3 hours or dry-cure for 2 weeks.

name: Kongnamul Muchim (Vegan)
instructions: Blanch bean sprouts. Drain and toss with soy sauce, sesame oil, minced garlic and gochugaru. Sprinkle with sesame seeds.

name: Korean BBQ Pork Belly (Samgyeopsal)
instructions: Slice pork belly into thick pieces. Grill at the table. Wrap in lettuce with ssamjang, raw garlic and kimchi.

name: Korean Grilled Fish
instructions: Score fish and brush with mixture of soy, sesame oil, garlic and ginger. Grill over medium-high heat until crispy. Garnish with green onions.

name: Korean Pork Cutlet (Donkkaseu)
instructions: Pound pork thin. Coat in flour, egg, then panko. Deep-fry at 350°F for 6-8 minutes until golden. Slice and serve with sauce and slaw.

name: Korean Pork Mandu (Dumplings)
instructions: Mix pork with crumbled tofu, chopped kimchi, garlic and sesame oil. Fill dumpling wrappers and steam or pan-fry for 10 minutes.

name: Korean Pork Ribs (Dweji Galbi)
instructions: Marinate ribs in soy sauce, pear puree, garlic, ginger, sesame oil and sugar for 4 hours. Grill until caramelized and charred.

name: Korean Vegetable Pancake (Vegan)
instructions: Make batter with flour and water. Add chopped vegetables. Pan-fry until crispy on both sides. Serve with soy-vinegar dipping sauce.

name: Kotlet Schabowy
instructions: Pound pork cutlets thin. Coat in flour, beaten egg, then breadcrumbs. Fry in hot lard for 3-4 minutes per side until golden. Serve with potatoes and cabbage.

name: Kung Pao Shrimp
instructions: Stir-fry shrimp with dried chilies and peanuts. Add sauce made from soy sauce, vinegar, sugar and cornstarch. Toss until sauce thickens and coats shrimp.

name: Kung Pao Tofu (Vegan)
instructions: Fry tofu cubes until crispy. Stir-fry with dried chilies and peanuts. Add sauce made from soy, vinegar and sugar. Toss until sauce thickens.

name: Kung Pao Tofu
instructions: Fry tofu cubes until crispy. Stir-fry with dried chilies and peanuts. Add sauce made from soy, vinegar and sugar. Toss until sauce thickens.

name: Labneh with Zaatar
instructions: Mix yogurt with salt. Strain through cheesecloth for 24 hours until thick. Spread on plate, make a well, drizzle with olive oil and sprinkle with zaatar. Serve with pita.

name: Laksa (Vegan)
instructions: Simmer laksa paste in coconut milk. Add tofu puffs. Cook noodles separately. Assemble bowls with noodles, soup, bean sprouts and mint.

name: Lamington (Vegan)
instructions: Cut cake into squares. Make chocolate icing with cocoa, sugar and milk. Dip cake in icing, then roll in coconut. Let set.

name: Lasagna Vegetariana
instructions: Layer cooked noodles with ricotta-spinach mixture, tomato sauce and mozzarella. Repeat layers. Top with parmesan. Bake at 375°F for 45 minutes until bubbly.

name: Lebanese Lentil Soup (Vegan)
instructions: Sauté onions and carrots. Add lentils, cumin and vegetable stock. Simmer 30 minutes until lentils are soft. Blend partially. Finish with lemon juice and olive oil.

name: Lebanese Rice with Vermicelli
instructions: Brown vermicelli in butter until golden. Add rice and toast briefly. Add stock and cinnamon. Cover and simmer for 20 minutes until rice is tender.

name: Leberkäse
instructions: Grind all meats finely. Mix with onions and spices. Pack into loaf pan. Bake at 350°F for 1.5 hours until browned. Slice and serve hot.

name: Lechon (Roast Pig)
instructions: Stuff pig cavity with aromatics. Secure on spit and roast over charcoal for 3-4 hours, constantly rotating until skin is crispy.

name: Lechona
instructions: Cook rice with peas, diced pork, onions and spices. Stuff pig cavity with rice mixture. Sew closed and roast for 6-8 hours until crispy.

name: Leitão à Pururuca
instructions: Rub pig with garlic, lime and cachaça. Cover skin with coarse salt. Roast at 325°F for 3 hours until skin crackles and meat is tender.

name: Leitão Assado
instructions: Rub suckling pig inside and out with garlic paste, lard and bay leaves. Roast at 350°F for 2.5 hours, basting with wine until skin is crispy.

name: Lentil Soup (German Style Vegan)
instructions: Simmer lentils with vegetables and bay leaves for 45 minutes. Season with vinegar and salt. Serve with crusty bread.

name: Lentil Soup (Greek Style Vegan)
instructions: Simmer lentils with vegetables and bay leaves for 45 minutes. Finish with vinegar and olive oil. Serve with crusty bread.

name: Lentil Soup (Vegan)
instructions: Sauté onions and carrots. Add lentils, cumin and vegetable stock. Simmer 30 minutes until lentils are soft. Blend partially. Finish with lemon juice and olive oil.

name: Linguiça Acebolada
instructions: Slice sausage and brown. Add sliced onions and peppers, cook until soft. Add tomatoes and cachaça. Simmer 15 minutes until sauce thickens.

name: Linguine ai Frutti di Mare
instructions: Sauté garlic, add tomatoes and wine. Add seafood and cook until done. Toss with cooked linguine and fresh parsley.

name: Lion's Head Meatballs
instructions: Form large meatballs from seasoned pork. Brown in oil, then braise with cabbage in soy sauce mixture for 45 minutes.

name: Lobster Roll
instructions: Mix lobster with mayo, diced celery and lemon juice. Toast buns in butter until golden. Fill generously with lobster salad. Serve immediately.

name: Lobster Thermidor
instructions: Boil lobster, remove meat and reserve shells. Make sauce with wine, cream, mustard and tarragon. Mix with lobster meat. Return to shells, top with cheese and broil.

name: Mac and Cheese
instructions: Make cheese sauce with butter, flour, milk and cheddar. Mix with cooked pasta. Transfer to baking dish, top with breadcrumbs. Bake at 375°F for 25 minutes.

name: Malabar Fish Curry
instructions: Temper mustard seeds and curry leaves. Add chili powder and tamarind. Add coconut milk and bring to boil. Add fish and simmer gently for 10 minutes.

name: Malai Kofta
instructions: Mix mashed paneer and potatoes, form into balls and deep-fry. Make creamy tomato gravy with cashew paste. Add koftas to gravy and simmer gently.

name: Manakish (Zaatar Flatbread Vegan)
instructions: Roll out dough into rounds. Mix zaatar with olive oil and spread on dough. Bake at 450°F for 8-10 minutes. Serve with tomatoes and cucumber.

name: Manakish (Zaatar Flatbread)
instructions: Roll out dough into rounds. Mix zaatar with olive oil and spread on dough. Bake at 450°F for 8-10 minutes. Serve with labneh, tomatoes and cucumber.

name: Manchego Cheese with Membrillo
instructions: Slice Manchego cheese and quince paste. Arrange on platter with walnuts and crackers. Serve as tapas or appetizer.

name: Mango Chutney (Vegan)
instructions: Dice mangoes. Cook with sugar, vinegar, ginger, pepper and raisins until thick. Cool and store. Serve as condiment.

name: Mapo Pork
instructions: Brown ground pork with garlic and ginger. Add doubanjiang, tofu cubes, and simmer. Finish with sichuan peppercorns.

name: Mapo Tofu (Vegan)
instructions: Stir-fry doubanjiang, garlic and ginger. Add vegetable broth and bring to boil. Add tofu cubes gently. Simmer and finish with sichuan peppercorns and scallions.

name: Mapo Tofu
instructions: Stir-fry doubanjiang, garlic and ginger. Add vegetable broth and bring to boil. Add tofu cubes gently. Simmer and finish with sichuan peppercorns and scallions.

name: Margherita Pizza
instructions: Roll out dough and spread with tomato sauce. Top with torn mozzarella and drizzle with olive oil. Bake at 475°F for 12-15 minutes. Add fresh basil after baking.

name: Marinated Anchovies (Gavros Marinatos)
instructions: Clean and fillet anchovies. Marinate in vinegar for 3 hours. Drain and dress with olive oil, sliced garlic and parsley. Refrigerate for 24 hours before serving.

name: Masala Dosa
instructions: Make potato filling with mustard seeds, curry leaves, turmeric and onions. Spread dosa batter thinly on hot griddle. Fill with potato masala and fold.

name: Massaman Curry with Salmon
instructions: Fry curry paste in coconut cream. Add coconut milk, potatoes and peanuts. Simmer until potatoes are soft. Add salmon chunks and tamarind, cook 8 minutes.

name: Massaman Curry with Vegetables (Vegan)
instructions: Fry curry paste in coconut cream. Add coconut milk, potatoes and peanuts. Simmer until potatoes are tender. Season with tamarind and sugar.

name: Massaman Curry with Vegetables
instructions: Fry curry paste in coconut cream. Add coconut milk, potatoes and peanuts. Simmer until potatoes are tender. Season with tamarind and sugar.

name: Mee Goreng (Vegan)
instructions: Stir-fry tempeh and vegetables. Add noodles, soy sauce and sambal. Toss over high heat. Serve with lime wedges.

name: Merluza en Salsa Verde (Hake in Green Sauce)
instructions: Sauté garlic in olive oil. Add hake, wine and clams. Cook until clams open. Add peas and parsley. Shake pan to emulsify sauce until green and creamy.

name: Mett (Raw Pork Spread)
instructions: Use very fresh, high-quality pork. Mix with finely diced onions, salt, pepper and caraway. Serve immediately on bread rolls. Must be consumed same day.

name: Mexican Street Corn (Vegan)
instructions: Grill corn until charred. Brush with vegan mayo. Roll in nutritional yeast. Sprinkle with chili powder and cilantro. Squeeze lime over top.

name: Minestrone Soup (Vegan)
instructions: Sauté vegetables, add tomatoes and stock. Add beans and simmer 30 minutes. Add pasta and cook until tender. Garnish with basil.

name: Minestrone Soup
instructions: Sauté vegetables, add tomatoes and stock. Add beans and parmesan rind. Simmer 30 minutes. Add pasta and cook until tender. Remove rind and garnish with basil.

name: Misir Wot (Spicy Red Lentils)
instructions: Sauté onions until caramelized. Add garlic, ginger and berbere. Add lentils and water. Simmer for 30 minutes until creamy. Serve with injera bread.

name: Misir Wot (Vegan)
instructions: Sauté onions until caramelized. Add garlic, ginger and berbere. Add lentils and water. Simmer for 30 minutes until creamy. Serve with injera bread.

name: Miso Glazed Black Cod
instructions: Mix miso, mirin, sake and sugar. Marinate cod for 24-48 hours. Broil for 8-10 minutes until fish caramelizes and flakes easily.

name: Miso Soup (Vegan)
instructions: Heat kombu dashi. Add cubed tofu and seaweed. Dissolve miso paste in a little hot stock and add to pot. Do not boil. Garnish with sliced scallions.

name: Miso Soup
instructions: Heat dashi stock. Add cubed tofu and seaweed. Dissolve miso paste in a little hot stock and add to pot. Do not boil. Garnish with sliced scallions.

name: Mjadra Rice (Vegan)
instructions: Cook lentils until tender. Add rice and spices, cook until rice is done. Caramelize onions separately. Serve rice topped with crispy onions.

name: Mofongo with Shrimp
instructions: Fry plantains until golden. Mash with garlic, cracklings and oil. Form into balls. Sauté shrimp in garlic sauce. Serve shrimp over mofongo.

name: Molletes
instructions: Split rolls and toast. Spread with refried beans and top with cheese. Broil until cheese melts. Top with pico de gallo and avocado.

name: Moo Ping (Grilled Pork Skewers)
instructions: Slice pork thinly. Marinate in coconut milk, sugar, fish sauce and spices for 4 hours. Thread on skewers and grill until charred.

name: Moong Dal Khichdi
instructions: Roast cumin in ghee, add ginger. Add rice and dal with turmeric. Cook with water until soft and porridge-like. Serve with yogurt and pickle.

name: Moqueca (Vegan)
instructions: Sauté peppers and tomatoes in palm oil. Add coconut milk and hearts of palm. Simmer 20 minutes. Garnish with cilantro. Serve with rice.

name: Moreton Bay Bug Tails
instructions: Split bug tails lengthwise. Grill flesh-side down for 3 minutes. Flip, brush with garlic butter and grill 2 minutes more. Serve with lemon and parsley.

name: Moroccan Carrot Salad (Vegan)
instructions: Steam carrots until tender. Slice into coins. Toss with cumin, paprika, lemon juice and olive oil. Garnish with cilantro. Serve at room temperature.

name: Moroccan Carrot Salad
instructions: Steam carrots until tender. Slice into coins. Toss with cumin, paprika, lemon juice and olive oil. Garnish with cilantro. Serve at room temperature.

name: Moroccan Couscous (Vegan)
instructions: Steam couscous over simmering vegetables and chickpeas. Fluff couscous and mix with vegetables, chickpeas and raisins. Serve with harissa on the side.

name: Moroccan Couscous
instructions: Steam couscous over simmering vegetables and chickpeas. Fluff couscous and mix with vegetables, chickpeas and raisins. Serve with harissa on the side.

name: Moroccan Lentil Soup (Harira)
instructions: Simmer lentils, chickpeas, vegetables and spices in stock for 1 hour. Add chopped cilantro and lemon juice. Serve with dates and bread.

name: Moroccan Lentils (Vegan)
instructions: Sauté onions with cumin and turmeric. Add lentils and tomatoes. Simmer 35 minutes until lentils are tender. Garnish with cilantro.

name: Moules Marinières
instructions: Sauté shallots and garlic in butter. Add wine and bring to boil. Add mussels and cover until they open. Garnish with parsley and serve with frites.

name: Moussaka
instructions: Slice and grill eggplant and potatoes. Make lentil-tomato sauce. Layer vegetables with sauce and top with béchamel and parmesan. Bake at 375°F for 45 minutes.

name: Muhammara (Vegan)
instructions: Blend roasted peppers with walnuts, breadcrumbs, pomegranate molasses and cumin. Drizzle with olive oil. Serve as dip with pita bread.

name: Muhammara
instructions: Blend roasted peppers with walnuts, breadcrumbs, pomegranate molasses and cumin. Drizzle with olive oil. Serve as dip with pita bread.

name: Mujadara (Vegan)
instructions: Cook lentils and rice together with cumin until tender. Deeply caramelize onions in olive oil. Top lentil-rice mixture with caramelized onions.

name: Mujadara (Vegan)
instructions: Cook lentils and rice together with cumin until tender. Deeply caramelize onions in olive oil. Top lentil-rice mixture with caramelized onions.

name: Mujadara
instructions: Cook lentils and rice together with cumin. Deeply caramelize onions in olive oil. Top lentil-rice with caramelized onions. Serve with yogurt.

name: Mujadd human
instructions: Cook lentils and rice together with cumin until tender. Deeply caramelize onions. Top lentil-rice mixture with caramelized onions. Serve with yogurt on the side.

name: Mushroom Masala (Vegan)
instructions: Sauté mushrooms until moisture evaporates. Make tomato-onion gravy with spices. Add mushrooms and simmer 15 minutes. Finish with coconut cream.

name: Mushroom Masala
instructions: Sauté mushrooms until moisture evaporates. Make tomato-onion gravy with spices. Add mushrooms and simmer 15 minutes. Finish with cream.

name: Mushroom Risotto
instructions: Sauté mushrooms with thyme, set aside. Toast rice, add wine then stock gradually, stirring constantly. Fold in mushrooms, butter and parmesan at the end.

name: Mushroom Vol-au-Vent
instructions: Sauté mushrooms and shallots in butter. Add wine and reduce. Add cream and thyme, simmer until thick. Fill baked puff pastry shells with mushroom mixture.

name: Mussels with Feta
instructions: Steam mussels in wine with garlic. Add tomatoes and oregano, simmer 5 minutes. Top with crumbled feta and broil until cheese softens.

name: Mutter Paneer
instructions: Make tomato-onion gravy with spices. Add paneer cubes and peas. Simmer until peas are cooked. Finish with cream and kasuri methi.

name: Naga Pork Curry
instructions: Boil pork until tender. Fry with ginger, garlic and naga chilies. Add bamboo shoots and toasted sesame seeds. Simmer until flavors meld.

name: Nakji Bokkeum (Spicy Octopus)
instructions: Clean and cut octopus. Mix with vegetables and spicy sauce. Stir-fry over high heat until octopus is tender. Finish with sesame oil.

name: Nasi Goreng (Vegan)
instructions: Fry tempeh and vegetables. Add cold cooked rice. Season with kecap manis and sambal. Top with fried shallots.

name: New England Clam Chowder
instructions: Cook bacon until crispy. Sauté onions and celery. Add potatoes and clam juice, simmer until tender. Add clams and cream. Heat through without boiling.

name: Northern Thai Pork Curry
instructions: Slow-cook pork with ginger, turmeric and shallots. Add tamarind and pickled garlic, simmer until pork is tender.

name: Norwegian Potato Pancakes (Vegan)
instructions: Grate potatoes. Mix with flour, milk and salt. Form into pancakes. Fry in oil until golden on both sides. Serve with lingonberries.

name: Octopus Takoyaki
instructions: Make batter with flour, dashi and eggs. Pour into takoyaki pan, add octopus pieces. Turn with picks until spherical and golden. Top with sauce and bonito flakes.

name: Ojingeo Bokkeum (Spicy Squid)
instructions: Cut squid into pieces. Stir-fry vegetables until soft. Add squid and sauce made from gochugaru and gochujang. Cook until squid is tender.

name: Okonomiyaki (Vegetarian)
instructions: Mix shredded cabbage with flour, eggs and dashi. Pour onto hot griddle and cook like a pancake. Top with sauce, mayo drizzle and bonito flakes.

name: Onigiri (Vegan)
instructions: Season rice with vinegar. Form into triangles with umeboshi in center. Wrap with nori strips. Sprinkle with sesame seeds.

name: Oyster Omelette
instructions: Mix oysters with starch and water to make batter. Pour into hot pan, add beaten eggs. Cook until crispy edges form. Fold and serve with chili sauce.

name: Oyster Po' Boy
instructions: Coat oysters in seasoned cornmeal. Deep-fry until golden and crispy. Layer on French bread with lettuce, tomatoes and remoulade sauce.

name: Oysters Rockefeller
instructions: Blend cooked spinach with butter, breadcrumbs, pernod and cheese. Top each oyster with mixture. Bake at 450°F for 10 minutes until golden and bubbling.

name: Pad Thai (Vegan)
instructions: Soak noodles. Stir-fry tofu. Add noodles, tamarind, sugar and soy sauce. Toss with bean sprouts and top with crushed peanuts.

name: Pad Thai (Vegetarian)
instructions: Soak noodles. Stir-fry tofu, push aside and scramble eggs. Add noodles, tamarind, sugar and fish sauce. Toss with bean sprouts and top with crushed peanuts.

name: Pad Thai with Shrimp
instructions: Soak noodles until soft. Stir-fry shrimp, push aside and scramble eggs. Add noodles, tamarind, fish sauce and sugar. Toss with bean sprouts and peanuts.

name: Paella Marinera
instructions: Sauté garlic, add tomatoes and paprika. Add rice and toast. Add saffron-infused stock. Arrange seafood on top. Cook without stirring for 20 minutes.

name: Palak Paneer
instructions: Blanch and puree spinach. Sauté onions, ginger-garlic and tomatoes. Add spinach puree and spices. Add cubed paneer and cream. Simmer for 10 minutes.

name: Pan con Tomate (Vegan)
instructions: Toast bread slices. Rub with cut garlic clove. Grate tomatoes and spread on bread. Drizzle generously with olive oil and sprinkle with salt.

name: Pan con Tomate
instructions: Toast bread slices. Rub with cut garlic clove. Grate tomatoes and spread on bread. Drizzle generously with olive oil and sprinkle with salt.

name: Pan-Fried Mackerel with Lingonberries
instructions: Pan-fry mackerel in butter, skin-side down first, for 4 minutes per side. Serve with lingonberry jam, lemon wedges and fresh dill.

name: Paneer Biryani
instructions: Marinate paneer in yogurt and spices. Layer par-cooked rice with paneer mixture, saffron milk, fried onions and mint. Cover and cook on low heat 30 minutes.

name: Paneer Butter Masala
instructions: Make rich tomato gravy with butter, cashew paste and spices. Add paneer cubes and simmer. Finish with cream and kasuri methi for authentic flavor.

name: Paneer Jalfrezi
instructions: Stir-fry bell peppers and onions over high heat. Add tomatoes and spices. Add paneer cubes and toss until everything is coated. Cook quickly to retain crunch.

name: Paneer Pasanda
instructions: Stuff paneer slices with nuts and raisins. Make rich cashew-tomato gravy with saffron and cream. Add stuffed paneer and simmer gently for 15 minutes.

name: Paneer Tikka
instructions: Marinate paneer cubes in yogurt, tikka masala and lemon for 2 hours. Thread on skewers with vegetables. Grill or bake at 400°F for 15 minutes.

name: Panzanella Salad (Vegan)
instructions: Tear bread into chunks and toast lightly. Dice tomatoes and cucumber. Toss with onions, basil, olive oil and vinegar. Let sit 30 minutes before serving.

name: Panzanella Salad
instructions: Tear bread into chunks and toast lightly. Dice tomatoes and cucumber. Toss with onions, basil, olive oil and vinegar. Let sit 30 minutes before serving.

name: Pão de Queijo
instructions: Heat milk and butter until boiling. Mix with tapioca flour. Add eggs and cheese. Form into balls. Bake at 375°F for 25 minutes until puffed and golden.

name: Pasta alla Norma (Vegan)
instructions: Fry eggplant cubes until golden. Make tomato sauce with basil. Toss pasta with sauce and eggplant.

name: Pasta alla Norma
instructions: Fry eggplant cubes until golden. Make tomato sauce with basil. Toss pasta with sauce and eggplant. Top with grated ricotta salata.

name: Pasta e Fagioli (Vegan)
instructions: Sauté garlic and rosemary. Add tomatoes and stock. Add beans and simmer 20 minutes. Add pasta and cook until tender.

name: Pasta Pomodoro (Vegan)
instructions: Sauté garlic in olive oil. Add crushed tomatoes and simmer 25 minutes. Add fresh basil. Toss with cooked pasta.

name: Pasta Pomodoro
