instructions: Sauté garlic in olive oil. Add crushed tomatoes and simmer 25 minutes. Add fresh basil. Toss with cooked pasta and finish with parmesan.

name: Pasta Primavera
instructions: Sauté vegetables with garlic in olive oil. Add cream and simmer. Toss with cooked pasta and parmesan. Season with salt, pepper and fresh herbs.

name: Pasta Puttanesca (Vegan)
instructions: Sauté garlic and chili flakes. Add tomatoes, olives and capers. Simmer 20 minutes. Toss with cooked spaghetti.

name: Pasta Salad (Vegan)
instructions: Cook pasta and cool. Toss with halved tomatoes, diced cucumber, olives and onions. Mix with vegan mayo. Chill before serving.

name: Patatas Bravas (Vegan)
instructions: Cut potatoes into cubes and fry until crispy. Make spicy tomato sauce with paprika and garlic. Drizzle sauce over potatoes.

name: Patatas Bravas
instructions: Cut potatoes into cubes and fry until crispy. Make spicy tomato sauce with paprika and garlic. Drizzle sauce over potatoes. Serve with aioli on the side.

name: Pav Bhaji (Vegan)
instructions: Boil and mash vegetables. Sauté onions in vegan butter. Add tomatoes and pav bhaji masala. Add mashed vegetables and cook until thick. Serve with toasted pav buns.

name: Pescado Frito (Fried Fish)
instructions: Season fish with lime, salt and garlic powder. Coat in flour and deep-fry at 375°F for 8-10 minutes until golden and crispy. Serve with rice, beans and salsa.

name: Pescado Zarandeado (Grilled Fish)
instructions: Butterfly fish. Mix mayo, lime, chipotle, garlic and Worcestershire. Coat fish generously. Grill over mesquite wood for 8 minutes per side.

name: Pesto Pasta
instructions: Blend basil, pine nuts, parmesan, garlic and olive oil into smooth pesto. Toss with hot cooked pasta. Add pasta water to loosen if needed. Garnish with extra parmesan.

name: Pho (Vegan)
instructions: Simmer broth with star anise, cinnamon and ginger for 1 hour. Cook noodles. Add mushrooms to broth. Assemble bowls with noodles, hot broth and fresh herbs.

name: Pickled Herring
instructions: Make brine with vinegar, sugar, bay leaves and peppercorns. Pour over herring and onions. Refrigerate for 3 days. Serve with boiled potatoes and sour cream.

name: Pinangat na Isda (Fish in Tomatoes)
instructions: Layer fish with tomatoes, onions and ginger in pot. Add fish sauce and water. Simmer covered for 20 minutes until fish is cooked.

name: Pineapple Fried Rice (Vegan)
instructions: Stir-fry cold rice with curry powder. Add pineapple, cashews and raisins. Mix everything together with soy sauce.

name: Pineapple Fried Rice
instructions: Stir-fry cold rice with curry powder. Add pineapple, cashews and raisins. Push aside and scramble eggs. Mix everything together with soy sauce.

name: Pisto (Vegan)
instructions: Sauté onions and peppers. Add zucchini and tomatoes. Simmer until thick and vegetables are soft. Serve with crusty bread.

name: Pisto
instructions: Sauté onions and peppers. Add zucchini and tomatoes. Simmer until thick and vegetables are soft. Top with fried eggs and serve with crusty bread.

name: Pistou Soup (Vegan)
instructions: Simmer vegetables in broth. Add pasta and cook until tender. Make pistou by blending basil, garlic and olive oil. Stir into soup before serving.

name: Plantain Curry (Vegan)
instructions: Sauté onions and curry powder. Add tomatoes and coconut milk. Add plantain chunks and pepper. Simmer 25 minutes until plantains are tender.

name: Poha
instructions: Rinse flattened rice and drain. Temper mustard seeds and curry leaves. Add potatoes, peas and onions. Add rice, turmeric and mix gently. Garnish with roasted peanuts.

name: Polvo à Lagareiro (Octopus with Olive Oil)
instructions: Boil octopus with bay leaves for 45 minutes until tender. Roast potatoes. Grill octopus until charred. Drizzle generously with olive oil and roasted garlic.

name: Porchetta
instructions: Butterfly pork belly, rub with garlic paste, herbs and spices. Roll tightly, tie and roast at 325°F for 3 hours until crispy.

name: Porco à Pica-Pau
instructions: Cut pork into small cubes. Marinate in beer, piri-piri and garlic for 2 hours. Quick-fry over high heat. Serve in clay pot with pickles and bread.

name: Pork and Apple Sausages
instructions: Mix pork with finely diced apples, sage and breadcrumbs. Stuff into casings and twist into links. Grill or pan-fry until golden and cooked through.

name: Pork and Chive Wontons
instructions: Mix pork with chopped chives, soy sauce and sesame oil. Wrap in wonton skins and boil in chicken broth for 8 minutes.

name: Pork and Eggplant Stir-Fry
instructions: Stir-fry garlic and ground pork. Add eggplant and cook until soft. Season with sauces and add basil at the end.

name: Pork and Mushroom Bao Buns
instructions: Stir-fry pork with mushrooms, ginger and hoisin. Stuff into bao dough, seal and steam for 15 minutes until fluffy.

name: Pork and Napa Cabbage Stir-Fry
instructions: Slice pork thinly. Stir-fry with ginger, add cabbage and cook until wilted. Season with oyster sauce and sesame oil.

name: Pork and Sauerkraut
instructions: Layer sauerkraut with sliced apples in Dutch oven. Top with pork roast. Sprinkle with sugar and caraway. Bake at 325°F for 3 hours.

name: Pork and Sausage Polenta
instructions: Brown pork and sausage. Add tomato sauce and simmer 1 hour. Cook polenta according to package. Serve meat sauce over polenta with parmesan.

name: Pork and Shrimp Rice Paper Rolls
instructions: Boil pork and shrimp until cooked. Slice thinly. Wrap in softened rice paper with noodles, lettuce and mint. Serve with peanut sauce.

name: Pork Andouillette
instructions: Clean and cook intestines and stomach with onions and wine until tender. Chop and stuff into casings. Grill and serve with mustard.

name: Pork Balchão
instructions: Grind chilies, shrimp and spices with vinegar. Fry onions, add pork and spice paste. Cook until pork is tender. Add jaggery and cook until thick.

name: Pork Blanquette
instructions: Poach pork in stock with wine. Add onions and mushrooms. Make sauce with cream and egg yolks. Combine and simmer gently without boiling.

name: Pork Boudin Noir
instructions: Cook onions in fat until soft. Mix with blood, cream and spices. Stuff into casings. Poach gently at 180°F for 30 minutes. Pan-fry to serve.

name: Pork Braciole
instructions: Pound pork thin. Top with breadcrumb mixture, roll and tie. Brown rolls and simmer in tomato sauce for 1.5 hours.

name: Pork Bulgogi (Dweji Bulgogi)
instructions: Slice pork thinly. Marinate in mixture of soy sauce, gochugaru, gochujang, garlic, ginger and sugar for 2 hours. Stir-fry over high heat.

name: Pork Chettinad
instructions: Roast and grind peppercorns, fennel and coconut. Brown pork with curry leaves. Add spice paste and tamarind water. Cook until pork is tender and sauce thick.

name: Pork Chimichangas
instructions: Shred cooked pork. Fill tortillas with pork, beans and cheese. Roll tightly and deep-fry until golden. Serve with salsa and guacamole.

name: Pork Chops Cafreal
instructions: Blend coriander, chilies, garlic, cumin and lime into green paste. Marinate pork chops for 3 hours. Grill or pan-fry until cooked through.

name: Pork Chops with Apple Sauce
instructions: Season and pan-fry pork chops until cooked through. Sauté diced apples in butter with sugar and cinnamon until soft. Serve chops topped with apple sauce.

name: Pork Chorizo
instructions: Blend rehydrated chilies with vinegar, garlic and spices. Mix thoroughly with ground pork. Refrigerate overnight to develop flavors. Cook crumbled or form into patties.

name: Pork Choucroute Garnie
instructions: Layer sauerkraut in pot with juniper and wine. Top with pork and sausages. Braise for 2 hours. Serve with boiled potatoes.

name: Pork Confit
instructions: Salt pork and refrigerate overnight. Rinse and pat dry. Submerge in duck fat with herbs and garlic. Cook at 200°F for 4 hours until tender.

name: Pork Coxinha
instructions: Mix shredded pork with cream cheese. Make dough from mashed potatoes and flour. Form into teardrop shapes around filling. Coat in egg and breadcrumbs, deep-fry.

name: Pork Croquetas
instructions: Make thick béchamel with butter, flour and milk. Mix in shredded pork. Chill, form into cylinders, coat in egg and breadcrumbs. Deep-fry.

name: Pork Dumplings
instructions: Mix pork with finely chopped cabbage, ginger, soy sauce and sesame oil. Wrap in dumpling skins and steam or pan-fry for 12 minutes.

name: Pork Empanada
instructions: Sauté pork with onions, peppers, tomato and paprika. Cool filling. Roll out dough, fill one half, fold and crimp edges. Bake at 375°F for 35 minutes.

name: Pork Enchiladas
instructions: Shred cooked pork. Dip tortillas in sauce, fill with pork and cheese. Roll and place in baking dish. Top with sauce and cheese. Bake at 375°F for 25 minutes.

name: Pork Flautas
instructions: Mix shredded pork with mashed potatoes. Roll tightly in tortillas and secure with toothpicks. Fry until crispy. Top with lettuce, crema and cheese.

name: Pork Fried Rice
instructions: Dice and stir-fry pork until cooked. Push aside, scramble eggs. Add rice, peas, soy sauce and toss everything together.

name: Pork Goulash (Polish Style)
instructions: Brown pork cubes with onions. Add paprika, tomato paste and marjoram. Cover with water and simmer for 2 hours. Stir in sour cream before serving.

name: Pork Gumbo
instructions: Make dark roux with flour and oil. Add vegetables and sauté. Add stock and okra. Slice sausage and add. Simmer 1 hour. Serve over rice.

name: Pork Jambalaya
instructions: Brown sausage. Add vegetables and sauté. Add rice, tomatoes, seasoning and stock. Cover and simmer for 25 minutes until rice is cooked.

name: Pork Kefta
instructions: Mix ground pork with minced onions, parsley and spices. Form into sausage shapes on skewers. Grill over charcoal until cooked through.

name: Pork Kimbap
instructions: Cook pork with soy sauce. Prepare vegetables. Spread rice on seaweed, layer with pork, vegetables and egg. Roll tightly and slice.

name: Pork Loin with Garlic and Paprika
instructions: Rub pork with garlic paste and paprika. Brown in oil. Add wine and roast at 350°F for 1 hour, basting occasionally.

name: Pork Lumpia
instructions: Stir-fry pork with vegetables and soy sauce until cooked. Cool slightly. Wrap in spring roll wrappers and deep-fry until golden and crispy.

name: Pork Madras Curry
instructions: Toast curry powder and mustard seeds. Brown pork with onions. Add curry powder, tomatoes and coconut milk. Simmer for 1 hour until tender.

name: Pork Meatballs in Almond Sauce
instructions: Form pork into meatballs with breadcrumbs. Brown and set aside. Blend almonds with saffron, wine and stock. Pour over meatballs and simmer 25 minutes.

name: Pork Mechoui Style
instructions: Rub pork with spice mixture and garlic. Coat with softened butter. Slow-roast at 275°F for 4 hours, basting every 30 minutes.

name: Pork Menudo
instructions: Brown pork cubes. Add tomato sauce and simmer 30 minutes. Add potatoes, carrots, liver and bell peppers. Cook until vegetables are tender.

name: Pork Milanese
instructions: Pound pork thin. Coat in flour, egg, then breadcrumbs mixed with parmesan. Pan-fry until golden. Top with arugula and lemon.

name: Pork Mole
instructions: Toast and blend chilies with nuts, chocolate, spices and raisins. Braise pork in mole sauce for 2 hours until tender and sauce is thick.

name: Pork Ossobuco
instructions: Brown pork shanks. Sauté vegetables, add wine and reduce. Add tomatoes and stock. Braise shanks for 2.5 hours until falling off bone.

name: Pork Pad See Ew
instructions: Stir-fry sliced pork. Push aside, add eggs and noodles. Add broccoli and sauces, toss everything over high heat.

name: Pork Paprikash
instructions: Brown pork with onions. Add paprika and peppers. Add water and simmer 1 hour. Stir in sour cream off heat. Serve with egg noodles.

name: Pork Pâté en Croûte
instructions: Mix pork, liver, pistachios and cognac. Encase in pastry and bake at 375°F for 1.5 hours. Pour aspic through chimney. Chill.

name: Pork Pörkölt
instructions: Caramelize onions. Add paprika and pork cubes. Brown well. Add tomatoes and peppers. Simmer for 1.5 hours until pork is tender and sauce is thick.

name: Pork Pot Roast
instructions: Brown pork in Dutch oven. Add vegetables, broth and thyme. Cover and braise at 325°F for 3 hours until meat and vegetables are tender.

name: Pork Potjiekos
instructions: Layer pork, vegetables and curry powder in cast iron pot. Pour beer over. Cook over coals for 2.5 hours without stirring until tender.

name: Pork Ragu
instructions: Sauté vegetables until soft. Brown pork, add wine and let reduce. Add tomatoes and milk. Simmer for 2 hours until rich and thick.

name: Pork Ramen
instructions: Braise pork belly in soy sauce for 2 hours. Make broth with miso and chicken stock. Cook noodles and assemble with sliced pork, eggs and onions.

name: Pork Ribs with Bush Tomato Glaze
instructions: Mix bush tomato, honey, soy and lemon myrtle for glaze. Rub ribs with spices. Slow-cook at 275°F for 3 hours, glazing in final 30 minutes.

name: Pork Ribs with Honey and Cider
instructions: Brown ribs on all sides. Add cider, honey, garlic and thyme. Cover and braise at 325°F for 2 hours. Uncover and glaze under broiler.

name: Pork Ribs
instructions: Remove membrane from ribs. Apply dry rub generously. Smoke at 225°F for 5 hours, spritzing with apple juice. Glaze with BBQ sauce in final 30 minutes.

name: Pork Rillettes
instructions: Slow-cook pork with fat, wine and aromatics for 4 hours until falling apart. Shred meat and mix with fat. Pack into jars and chill.

name: Pork Sancocho
instructions: Boil pork ribs for 1 hour. Add yuca, plantains and corn. Simmer until vegetables are tender. Season with cilantro and serve in bowls.

name: Pork Satay
instructions: Marinate sliced pork in coconut milk, curry powder and turmeric for 2 hours. Skewer and grill. Serve with peanut sauce.

name: Pork Scaloppine with Marsala
instructions: Pound pork thin, dredge in flour. Pan-fry until golden. Remove and sauté mushrooms. Deglaze with marsala, return pork and coat with sauce.

name: Pork Schmorbraten
instructions: Brown pork with bacon and vegetables. Add beer and tomato paste. Cover and braise at 325°F for 3 hours. Strain sauce and serve over sliced pork.

name: Pork Sinigang
instructions: Boil pork ribs with tomatoes until tender. Add tamarind paste, radish and cook. Add water spinach and fish sauce just before serving.

name: Pork Sorpotel
instructions: Cook pork and liver with spices. Blend chilies with vinegar and tamarind. Add to meat with jaggery. Simmer until thick. Best after 24 hours.

name: Pork Sosaties
instructions: Cut pork into cubes. Marinate in curry, vinegar, sugar and apricots overnight. Thread on skewers with onions and apricots. Grill until caramelized.

name: Pork Spiedini
instructions: Cut pork into cubes. Thread on skewers alternating with bread and bay leaves. Brush with oil, lemon and oregano. Grill until cooked.

name: Pork Tacos al Pastor
instructions: Marinate sliced pork in chili-achiote paste overnight. Stack and roast vertically. Slice thin and serve in tortillas with pineapple, cilantro and onions.

name: Pork Tagine with Prunes
instructions: Brown pork cubes. Add onions, spices, honey and prunes. Add water and simmer in tagine for 2 hours. Toast almonds and sprinkle on top.

name: Pork Tamales
instructions: Braise pork with chile sauce. Shred meat. Beat lard with masa and broth. Spread on corn husks, add pork, fold and steam for 1.5 hours.

name: Pork Tenderloin with Mustard Glaze
instructions: Mix mustard, honey, garlic and rosemary. Coat pork tenderloin. Roast at 375°F for 25-30 minutes until internal temperature reaches 145°F. Let rest before slicing.

name: Pork Terrine
instructions: Line terrine with bacon. Mix pork, liver, cognac, pistachios and eggs. Pack into terrine. Bake in water bath at 325°F for 2 hours. Chill overnight.

name: Pork Tocino
instructions: Slice pork thinly. Mix with sugar, salt, garlic, pineapple juice and coloring. Marinate overnight. Pan-fry until caramelized.

name: Pork Tom Yum Soup
instructions: Boil pork ribs with lemongrass, galangal and lime leaves for 45 minutes. Season with fish sauce, lime juice and chilies.

name: Pork Tostadas
instructions: Cook ground pork with taco seasoning. Spread beans on tostada shells. Top with pork, lettuce, tomatoes, cheese and crema.

name: Pork Vindaloo
instructions: Blend vinegar, chilies, garlic, ginger and spices into paste. Marinate pork for 4 hours. Brown pork, add marinade and water. Simmer 1.5 hours until tender.

name: Pork with Clams (Carne de Porco à Alentejana)
instructions: Marinate pork in paprika, garlic and wine. Fry pork cubes until golden. Steam clams in wine. Combine and garnish with cilantro.

name: Pork with Olives and Lemon
instructions: Brown pork cubes. Add olives, preserved lemons, saffron and ginger. Cover with water and simmer 1.5 hours. Garnish with fresh cilantro.

name: Pork with Prunes (Porc aux Pruneaux)
instructions: Brown pork medallions in butter. Remove and sauté prunes. Deglaze with wine, reduce. Add cream and return pork. Simmer 10 minutes.

name: Pork Xacuti
instructions: Roast and grind poppy seeds, coconut, star anise and chilies. Brown pork. Add spice paste and tamarind water. Simmer for 1.5 hours.

name: Pork Yakitori
instructions: Cut pork and green onions into pieces. Thread alternately on skewers. Make tare sauce with soy, mirin, sake and sugar. Grill, basting with sauce.

name: Pozole Rojo
instructions: Boil pork until tender. Make red chile sauce with guajillo peppers. Add hominy and sauce to pork broth. Simmer 1 hour. Serve with radishes and cabbage.

name: Prawn Masala
instructions: Sauté onions until golden. Add ginger-garlic and spices. Add tomatoes and cook until oil separates. Add prawns and cook 5 minutes. Garnish with coriander.

name: Prawn Skewers with Bush Tomato
instructions: Marinate prawns in olive oil, bush tomato, lemon myrtle and garlic for 1 hour. Thread on skewers. Grill for 3 minutes per side until pink.

name: Provencal Vegetable Tart (Vegan)
instructions: Roll out puff pastry. Arrange thinly sliced vegetables on top. Drizzle with olive oil and thyme. Bake at 400°F for 30 minutes until pastry is golden.

name: Psari Plaki (Baked Fish)

ingredients.name: whole fish (sea bream or sea bass)

instructions: Sauté onions, garlic and tomatoes. Place fish in baking dish with sauce. Drizzle with olive oil and lemon juice. Bake at 375°F for 30 minutes.

name: Puerto Rican Pernil
instructions: Make adobo paste with garlic, oregano, oil, vinegar and seasoning. Score pork skin and rub with paste. Marinate overnight. Roast at 350°F for 4 hours.

name: Pulled Pork
instructions: Rub pork with spice mixture. Smoke at 225°F for 12-14 hours until tender. Shred meat and mix with BBQ sauce. Serve on buns with coleslaw.

name: Pulpo a la Gallega (Galician Octopus)
instructions: Boil octopus with bay leaf for 45 minutes until tender. Slice and arrange over boiled potato rounds. Drizzle with olive oil and sprinkle with paprika and salt.

name: Quiche Lorraine (Vegetarian)
instructions: Blind bake crust. Sauté mushrooms and onions. Mix eggs with cream, cheese and nutmeg. Add vegetables to crust, pour egg mixture over. Bake at 375°F for 35 minutes.

name: Rajas con Crema
instructions: Roast and slice poblanos. Sauté with onions and corn. Add crema and cheese. Simmer until thick. Serve with warm tortillas.

name: Rajma Masala (Vegan)
instructions: Soak and cook kidney beans until soft. Make thick onion-tomato gravy with spices. Add beans and simmer 30 minutes. Serve with rice.

name: Rajma Masala
instructions: Soak and cook kidney beans until soft. Make thick onion-tomato gravy with spices. Add beans and simmer 30 minutes. Serve with rice.

name: Rape a la Plancha (Grilled Monkfish)
instructions: Slice monkfish into medallions. Grill on hot plancha for 3-4 minutes per side. Drizzle with olive oil, lemon, garlic and parsley mixture.

name: Ratatouille (Vegan)
instructions: Slice vegetables thinly. Sauté onions and garlic. Add tomatoes and herbs, simmer 20 minutes. Layer sliced vegetables in baking dish. Pour sauce over. Bake at 375°F for 45 minutes.

name: Red Braised Pork Belly
instructions: Blanch pork belly, then braise with soy sauce, sugar, spices and wine for 2 hours until meltingly tender.

name: Red Cabbage (Vegan)
instructions: Shred cabbage. Cook with diced apples, vinegar, sugar, cloves and bay leaves for 45 minutes. Serve as side dish.

name: Rellenong Bangus (Stuffed Milkfish)
instructions: Debone milkfish carefully, keeping skin intact. Mix deboned meat with sautéed vegetables and eggs. Stuff back into fish skin and fry or bake until golden.

name: Revithada (Greek Chickpea Stew)
instructions: Soak chickpeas overnight. Simmer with onions, garlic and bay leaves for 2-3 hours until very creamy. Finish with lemon juice and olive oil.

name: Revithada (Vegan)
instructions: Soak chickpeas overnight. Simmer with onions, garlic and bay leaves for 2-3 hours until very creamy. Finish with lemon juice and olive oil.

name: Ribollita (Vegan)
instructions: Simmer vegetables and beans in broth for 1 hour. Layer torn bread with soup in baking dish. Bake at 350°F for 30 minutes until crusty.

name: Ribollita
instructions: Simmer vegetables, beans and parmesan rind in broth for 1 hour. Layer torn bread with soup in baking dish. Bake at 350°F for 30 minutes until crusty.

name: Risotto ai Funghi
instructions: Toast rice with onions. Add wine, then gradually add stock, stirring constantly. Add sautéed mushrooms halfway through. Finish with butter and parmesan.

name: Roast Pork with Crackling
instructions: Score pork skin deeply. Rub with oil, garlic and rosemary. Cover skin with salt. Roast at 425°F for 30 min, then 350°F for 1.5 hours.

name: Roasted Cauliflower with Tahini (Vegan)
instructions: Roast cauliflower florets with cumin at 425°F for 30 minutes. Make tahini sauce with lemon and garlic. Drizzle over cauliflower. Garnish with pomegranate seeds.

name: Rojak (Vegan)
instructions: Cut fruits and vegetables into pieces. Make dressing with tamarind, sugar and chili. Toss everything together and top with crushed peanuts.

name: Rojões
instructions: Marinate pork cubes in wine, garlic, bay leaves and paprika overnight. Fry in lard until golden and crispy. Serve with roasted chestnuts.

name: Roti Canai (Vegan)
instructions: Make dough with flour, oil, salt and water. Rest 1 hour. Stretch very thin, fold and cook on griddle until crispy and layered. Serve with curry.

name: Saag Aloo (Vegan)
instructions: Blanch and chop spinach. Temper cumin seeds, add onions and ginger-garlic. Add potatoes and cook until tender. Add spinach and spices, cook 10 minutes.

name: Saag Aloo
instructions: Blanch and chop spinach. Temper cumin seeds, add onions and ginger-garlic. Add potatoes and cook until tender. Add spinach and spices, cook 10 minutes.

name: Saengseon Jjigae (Fish Stew)
instructions: Make broth with soybean paste, gochugaru and garlic. Add zucchini and tofu. Add fish chunks and simmer until cooked. Serve with rice.

name: Salade Niçoise (Vegetarian)
instructions: Blanch green beans. Boil potatoes. Arrange with tomatoes, eggs, olives and capers on plate. Dress with olive oil and vinegar.

name: Salmon Burgers
instructions: Chop salmon finely. Mix with breadcrumbs, egg, dill and lemon zest. Form into patties. Grill or pan-fry for 4 minutes per side. Serve on buns with tartar sauce.

name: Salmon en Papillote
instructions: Place salmon on parchment with vegetables, wine, butter, lemon and herbs. Seal packages. Bake at 400°F for 15 minutes. Serve in parchment.

name: Salmon Teriyaki
instructions: Make teriyaki sauce with soy, mirin, sake and sugar. Pan-fry salmon until half-cooked. Add sauce and baste until glazed and caramelized.

name: Salsichas Assadas
instructions: Grill sausages until charred. Make sauce with olive oil, minced garlic, bay leaves and wine. Pour over sausages and serve with crusty bread.

name: Salt and Pepper Squid
instructions: Score squid in crosshatch pattern, cut into pieces. Coat in cornstarch, salt and pepper. Deep-fry until crispy. Toss with fried garlic and chilies.

name: Saltimbocca alla Romana
instructions: Top each pork slice with prosciutto and sage, secure with toothpick. Dredge in flour and pan-fry. Deglaze with wine and butter.

name: Samak Mashwi (Grilled Fish)
instructions: Marinate fish in olive oil, lemon, garlic, coriander and cumin for 2 hours. Grill over charcoal for 10 minutes per side. Serve with tahini and flatbread.

name: Sambal Goreng Tempeh (Vegan)
instructions: Fry tempeh until crispy. Make sauce with sambal, coconut milk, sugar and tamarind. Add tempeh and simmer until sauce thickens.

name: Sambhar
instructions: Cook dal until soft. Add vegetables and sambhar powder. Add tamarind paste and simmer until vegetables are tender. Temper mustard seeds and curry leaves, pour over sambhar.

name: Sardinas Asadas (Grilled Sardines)
instructions: Season sardines with coarse salt. Grill over high heat for 3-4 minutes per side until skin is crispy. Drizzle with olive oil and lemon juice.

name: Sardines Portuguesas
instructions: Season sardines with coarse salt. Grill over charcoal for 4 minutes per side. Serve with roasted peppers, tomato salad and crusty bread.

name: Sardines Sicilian Style
instructions: Clean sardines. Layer in baking dish with breadcrumbs, pine nuts, raisins and fennel. Drizzle with olive oil. Bake at 375°F for 20 minutes.

name: Sashimi Platter
instructions: Slice fish against the grain into thin pieces. Arrange artfully on plate with shredded daikon. Serve with wasabi and soy sauce for dipping.

name: Sauerbraten (Pork Version)
instructions: Marinate pork in vinegar, wine and onions for 3 days. Brown meat, add marinade and braise for 2.5 hours. Thicken sauce with gingersnaps and raisins.

name: Sauerkraut (Vegan)
instructions: Sauté onions. Add sauerkraut, diced apples and caraway. Simmer 30 minutes. Serve with potatoes or bread.

name: Sausage and Peppers
instructions: Brown sausages and set aside. Sauté peppers, onions and garlic. Add tomatoes and return sausages. Simmer 30 minutes.

name: Sayadieh (Lebanese Fish and Rice)
instructions: Fry fish and set aside. Caramelize onions. Cook rice in fish stock with cumin and half the onions. Serve rice topped with fish, remaining onions and tahini sauce.

name: Sayur Lodeh (Vegan)
instructions: Simmer coconut milk with lemongrass, galangal and bay leaves. Add vegetables and tempeh. Cook until vegetables are tender.

name: Scallion Pancakes (Vegan)
instructions: Make dough with flour and water. Roll thin, brush with sesame oil and sprinkle with scallions. Roll up, coil and flatten. Pan-fry until golden and crispy.

name: Scallion Pancakes
instructions: Make dough with flour and water. Roll thin, brush with sesame oil and sprinkle with scallions. Roll up, coil and flatten. Pan-fry until golden and crispy.

name: Scallops with XO Sauce
instructions: Sear scallops on high heat until golden, 2 minutes per side. Remove. Stir-fry asparagus with garlic and XO sauce. Add scallops and wine, toss briefly.

name: Scampi all'Aglio (Garlic Prawns)
instructions: Sauté garlic and chili in butter and oil. Add prawns and cook 2 minutes per side. Deglaze with wine. Toss with parsley and serve with bread.

name: Schnitzel
instructions: Pound pork thin. Coat in flour, beaten egg, then breadcrumbs. Pan-fry in clarified butter until golden on both sides. Serve with lemon wedges.

name: Schweinshaxe (Pork Knuckle)
instructions: Score pork skin and rub with salt and caraway. Roast at 350°F for 2 hours with beer, onions and garlic, basting frequently until crispy.

name: Seafood Bisque
instructions: Roast shells with tomato paste. Flambe with cognac. Add stock and simmer 45 minutes. Strain, blend, strain again. Finish with cream and butter.

name: Seafood Risotto
instructions: Toast rice with onions. Add wine, then gradually add stock, stirring constantly. Add seafood in last 5 minutes. Finish with butter and parmesan.

name: Secreto Iberico
instructions: Marinate pork in oil, garlic, paprika and vinegar for 2 hours. Grill over high heat for 3-4 minutes per side. Let rest and slice thin.

name: Shakshuka (Vegan)
instructions: Make spiced tomato sauce with peppers, onions and cumin. Crumble tofu into sauce and simmer 15 minutes. Serve with crusty bread.

name: Shakshuka
instructions: Make spiced tomato sauce with peppers, onions and cumin. Create wells and crack eggs into sauce. Cover and cook until eggs are set. Crumble feta on top.

name: Shiro Wot (Vegan)
instructions: Sauté onions until soft. Add berbere, garlic and ginger. Mix chickpea flour with water and add to pot. Simmer, stirring, until thick like porridge.

name: Shiro Wot
instructions: Sauté onions until soft. Add berbere, garlic and ginger. Mix chickpea flour with water and add to pot. Simmer, stirring, until thick like porridge.

name: Shrimp and Grits
instructions: Cook grits until creamy, stir in cheese. Fry bacon, sauté shrimp in bacon fat with garlic. Deglaze with lemon juice. Serve shrimp over cheesy grits.

name: Shrimp Enchiladas
instructions: Sauté shrimp with spices. Fill tortillas with shrimp and cheese. Roll and place in baking dish. Top with sauce and cheese. Bake at 375°F for 25 minutes.

name: Shrimp Étouffée
instructions: Make dark roux. Sauté trinity (onions, celery, peppers). Add tomatoes and stock. Add shrimp and Cajun seasoning. Simmer 10 minutes. Serve over rice.

name: Shrimp Fatteh
instructions: Toast pita until crispy. Layer with yogurt-tahini sauce. Top with sautéed shrimp. Garnish with toasted pine nuts and pomegranate seeds.

name: Sichuan Boiled Fish
instructions: Boil vegetables in spicy broth with doubanjiang. Add fish slices and poach 3-4 minutes. Top with dried chilies and peppercorns, pour hot oil over.

name: Sichuan Pork Stir-Fry
instructions: Slice pork thinly. Stir-fry with dried chilies, peppercorns and garlic until fragrant. Add pork and peanuts, cook until done.

name: Sinigang na Hipon (Sour Shrimp Soup)
instructions: Simmer tamarind, tomatoes and radish until soft. Add shrimp and cook 4 minutes. Add water spinach and fish sauce just before serving.

name: Sisig
instructions: Grill pork and liver until crispy, chop finely. Mix with onions, chilies and calamansi. Serve on sizzling plate topped with raw egg.

name: Smoked Salmon Platter
instructions: Arrange smoked salmon slices on platter. Serve with cream cheese, capers, thinly sliced red onions, fresh dill and rye bread.

name: Sole Meunière
instructions: Dredge sole in flour. Pan-fry in clarified butter until golden. Remove fish. Brown butter until nutty, add lemon juice. Pour over fish and garnish with parsley.

name: Som Tam (Papaya Salad Vegan)
instructions: Shred papaya. Pound chilies with garlic. Add papaya, tomatoes, beans, lime juice and sugar. Pound lightly to bruise. Top with peanuts.

name: Som Tam (Papaya Salad)
instructions: Shred papaya. Pound chilies with garlic. Add papaya, tomatoes, beans, lime juice and sugar. Pound lightly to bruise. Top with peanuts.

name: Spaghetti alle Vongole (Clams)
instructions: Cook spaghetti al dente. Sauté garlic and chili in olive oil. Add clams and wine, cover until clams open. Toss with pasta and parsley.

name: Spanakopita
instructions: Sauté spinach with onions. Mix with crumbled feta, eggs and dill. Layer phyllo with butter, add filling, top with more phyllo. Bake at 375°F for 45 minutes.

name: Spanish Tortilla
instructions: Slowly cook sliced potatoes and onions in olive oil until tender. Beat eggs and mix with potato mixture. Pour into pan and cook until set. Flip and cook other side.

name: Spicy Raw Fish Salad (Hoe Dupbap)
instructions: Arrange sashimi and greens over rice. Make spicy dressing with gochujang, sesame oil and vinegar. Pour over and mix thoroughly before eating.

name: Spicy Seafood Stew (Haemul Jjigae)
instructions: Make spicy broth with gochugaru and gochujang. Add tofu and zucchini. Add seafood and simmer until cooked. Serve bubbling hot in stone pot.

name: Spinach Fatayer (Vegan)
instructions: Sauté spinach with onions, lemon juice and sumac. Roll dough into circles, add filling and fold into triangles. Bake at 400°F for 15 minutes until golden.

name: Spinach Fatayer
instructions: Sauté spinach with onions, lemon juice and sumac. Roll dough into circles, add filling and fold into triangles. Bake at 400°F for 15 minutes until golden.

name: Spring Rolls (Vegan)
instructions: Stir-fry vegetables with soaked glass noodles and soy sauce. Cool filling. Wrap in spring roll wrappers and deep-fry at 350°F until golden.

name: Spring Rolls (Vegan)
instructions: Soften rice paper. Fill with vermicelli, tofu, lettuce and herbs. Roll tightly and serve with peanut dipping sauce.

name: Spring Rolls (Vegetarian)
instructions: Stir-fry vegetables with soaked glass noodles and soy sauce. Cool filling. Wrap in spring roll wrappers and deep-fry at 350°F until golden.

name: Squid Ika Somen
instructions: Clean squid and slice body into very thin noodle-like strips. Arrange on plate with shiso leaves. Serve with soy-wasabi dipping sauce and grated ginger.

name: Squid with Basil and Chili
instructions: Score squid and cut into pieces. Stir-fry garlic and chilies until fragrant. Add squid and cook 2 minutes. Add sauces and basil, toss quickly.

name: Squid with Celery
instructions: Score and cut squid. Stir-fry garlic and onions. Add celery and squid, cook 2-3 minutes. Season with fish sauce and pepper.

name: Steamed Egg with Shrimp
instructions: Beat eggs with dashi and fish sauce. Add chopped shrimp and scallions. Steam in covered pot for 12-15 minutes until set but still jiggly.

name: Steamed Fish with Ginger and Scallions
instructions: Steam whole fish with ginger slices for 10-12 minutes. Top with julienned ginger and scallions. Heat oil until smoking and pour over fish. Drizzle with soy sauce.

name: Steamed Fish with Lime and Chili
instructions: Steam whole fish for 12 minutes. Make sauce with lime juice, fish sauce, minced chilies and garlic. Pour over fish and garnish with cilantro.

name: Steamed Mussels with Lemongrass
instructions: Steam mussels with lemongrass, ginger and beer until they open. Toss with melted butter and fresh cilantro. Serve with crusty bread.

name: Stir-Fried Crab with Ginger and Scallions
instructions: Cut crab into pieces. Stir-fry with julienned ginger over high heat. Add scallions, wine, soy sauce and sugar. Toss until crab is cooked through.

name: Stuffed Cabbage Rolls (Golabki)
instructions: Mix ground pork with cooked rice and onions. Wrap in blanched cabbage leaves. Place in baking dish with tomato sauce. Bake at 350°F for 1.5 hours.

name: Stuffed Grape Leaves (Vegan)
instructions: Mix cooked rice with herbs and onions. Wrap in grape leaves. Layer in pot, cover with water, lemon and oil. Simmer for 45 minutes.

name: Stuffed Grape Leaves (Vegan)
instructions: Mix rice with chopped tomatoes, herbs and oil. Wrap in grape leaves. Layer in pot with lemon juice. Simmer for 1 hour.

name: Stuffed Pork Chops
instructions: Cut pocket in each pork chop. Mix bread cubes with diced apples, sage, butter and broth. Stuff chops and secure. Bake at 375°F for 35 minutes.

name: Sudado de Pescado (Fish Stew)
instructions: Layer onions, tomatoes and aji in pot. Place fish on top. Add beer. Cover and steam for 15 minutes. Garnish with cilantro. Serve with rice.

name: Sundae (Blood Sausage with Pork)
instructions: Mix blood with cooked noodles, barley, perilla seeds and green onions. Stuff into cleaned intestines and steam for 30 minutes. Slice and serve.

name: Suquet de Peix (Catalan Fish Stew)
instructions: Make picada with almonds, garlic and saffron. Cook potatoes in fish stock. Add tomatoes and fish. Stir in picada and simmer until fish is cooked.

name: Sushi Rolls (California Roll)
instructions: Season rice with vinegar and sugar. Spread on nori, add crab, avocado and cucumber. Roll tightly with bamboo mat. Slice and garnish with sesame seeds.

name: Swedish Pea Soup (Vegan)
instructions: Simmer split peas with vegetables, stock and thyme for 1.5 hours until creamy. Stir in mustard before serving.

name: Sweet and Sour Fish
instructions: Coat fish in cornstarch and deep-fry until crispy. Stir-fry vegetables and pineapple. Make sweet and sour sauce, add fish and toss to coat.

name: Sweet and Sour Pork
instructions: Cut pork into cubes, coat with cornstarch and fry until golden. Stir-fry vegetables, add sauce made from vinegar and sugar, combine with pork.

name: Sweet and Sour Vegetables (Vegan)
instructions: Fry tofu cubes. Stir-fry vegetables. Make sweet and sour sauce with vinegar, sugar and ketchup. Add tofu and vegetables, toss to coat.

name: Tabbouleh (Vegan)
instructions: Soak bulgur in water for 30 minutes. Drain and mix with finely chopped parsley, mint, tomatoes and cucumber. Dress with lemon juice and olive oil.

name: Tabbouleh
instructions: Soak bulgur in water for 30 minutes. Drain and mix with finely chopped parsley, mint, tomatoes and cucumber. Dress with lemon juice and olive oil.

name: Taktouka (Vegan)
instructions: Roast peppers until charred, peel and dice. Sauté garlic and spices. Add tomatoes and peppers. Cook until thick. Serve with bread.

name: Tamarind Fish
instructions: Deep-fry whole fish until crispy. Make sweet-sour-spicy sauce with tamarind, sugar, fish sauce, fried shallots and chilies. Pour over fish.

name: Tandoori Fish
instructions: Marinate fish in yogurt, tandoori masala, ginger-garlic and lemon for 2 hours. Grill in tandoor or oven at 450°F for 12-15 minutes.

name: Tempeh Rendang (Vegan)
instructions: Simmer tempeh in coconut milk with rendang paste, lemongrass and lime leaves for 1.5 hours until dry and caramelized. Add tamarind.

name: Tempura Shrimp
instructions: Make light batter with flour, egg and ice water. Dip shrimp and deep-fry at 350°F for 2-3 minutes until golden. Serve with tentsuyu dipping sauce.

name: Thai Basil Eggplant (Vegan)
instructions: Fry eggplant until soft. Stir-fry garlic and chilies. Add eggplant and soy sauce. Toss until well coated. Add basil at the last moment.

name: Thai Basil Eggplant
instructions: Fry eggplant until soft. Stir-fry garlic and chilies. Add eggplant and sauces. Toss until well coated. Add basil at the last moment.

name: Thai Basil Pork
instructions: Stir-fry garlic and chilies until fragrant. Add ground pork and cook through. Add sauces and basil, toss quickly and serve over rice.

name: Thai Corn Cakes (Vegan)
instructions: Mix corn with curry paste, flour, sliced beans and shredded lime leaves. Form into patties. Pan-fry until golden on both sides. Serve with sweet chili sauce.

name: Thai Corn Cakes
instructions: Mix corn with curry paste, flour, egg, sliced beans and shredded lime leaves. Form into patties. Pan-fry until golden on both sides. Serve with sweet chili sauce.

name: Thai Crispy Pork Belly
instructions: Rub pork with salt, pepper and coriander. Air-dry overnight. Deep-fry at 350°F until skin is crispy, about 15 minutes.

name: Thai Fish Cakes
instructions: Blend fish with curry paste, egg and fish sauce. Fold in sliced green beans and shredded lime leaves. Form into patties and deep-fry until golden.

name: Thai Peanut Noodles (Vegan)
instructions: Cook noodles. Make sauce with peanut butter, soy, lime, sugar and chili. Toss noodles with sauce and sautéed vegetables. Garnish with crushed peanuts.

name: Thai Peanut Noodles
instructions: Cook noodles. Make sauce with peanut butter, soy, lime, sugar and chili. Toss noodles with sauce and sautéed vegetables. Garnish with crushed peanuts.

name: Thai Pork and Green Beans
instructions: Stir-fry curry paste until fragrant. Add ground pork and cook through. Add green beans, sauce and lime leaves, cook until beans are tender.

name: Thai Pork Larb
instructions: Cook ground pork thoroughly. Mix with lime juice, fish sauce, rice powder, herbs and sliced shallots. Serve with lettuce.

name: Thai Pork Panang Curry
instructions: Fry curry paste with thick coconut milk. Add sliced pork and remaining coconut milk. Simmer with peanuts and sugar until thick.

name: Thai Red Curry Pork
instructions: Fry curry paste until fragrant. Add coconut milk and pork, simmer 30 minutes. Add bamboo shoots and basil before serving.

name: Thai Spring Rolls (Vegan)
instructions: Soften rice paper in water. Fill with vermicelli, tofu, lettuce and herbs. Roll tightly. Serve with peanut dipping sauce.

name: Thai Spring Rolls
instructions: Soften rice paper in water. Fill with vermicelli, tofu, lettuce and herbs. Roll tightly. Serve with peanut dipping sauce.

name: Thai Vegetable Curry (Vegan)
instructions: Fry curry paste until fragrant. Add coconut milk. Add vegetables and bamboo shoots. Simmer until tender. Add basil and sugar before serving.

name: Thai Vegetable Curry
instructions: Fry curry paste until fragrant. Add coconut milk. Add vegetables and bamboo shoots. Simmer until tender. Add basil and sugar before serving.

name: Tiradito
instructions: Slice fish paper-thin. Blend lime juice with aji, garlic, ginger and soy. Arrange fish on plate and pour sauce over. Serve immediately.

name: Tiropita (Cheese Pie)
instructions: Mix cheeses with eggs and nutmeg. Layer phyllo with butter in baking dish. Add cheese filling. Top with more phyllo. Bake at 375°F for 40 minutes until golden.

name: Tom Kha (Coconut Soup with Vegetables)
instructions: Simmer coconut milk with galangal, lemongrass and lime leaves. Add vegetables and mushrooms. Cook until tender. Season with lime juice.

name: Tom Yum Goong (Spicy Shrimp Soup)
instructions: Boil lemongrass, galangal and lime leaves in stock. Add shrimp and cook 3 minutes. Season with fish sauce, lime juice and chilies. Garnish with cilantro.

name: Tom Yum Soup (Vegan)
instructions: Simmer lemongrass, galangal and lime leaves in vegetable stock. Add mushrooms and tomatoes. Season with lime juice and chilies. Garnish with cilantro.

name: Tonkatsu
instructions: Pound pork cutlets thin. Coat in flour, beaten egg, then panko. Deep-fry at 350°F for 6-8 minutes until golden. Slice and drizzle with sauce.

name: Torresmo
instructions: Cut pork belly into strips. Season with salt, garlic and lime. Fry in own fat over medium heat for 45 minutes until skin puffs and meat is crispy.

name: Tortilla Soup (Vegan)
instructions: Blend tomatoes with spices. Simmer in broth for 20 minutes. Serve in bowls topped with tortilla chips, avocado and cilantro.

name: Tortilla Soup
instructions: Blend tomatoes with spices. Simmer in broth for 20 minutes. Serve in bowls topped with tortilla chips, cheese, avocado and cilantro.

name: Tostadas de Ceviche
instructions: Chop shrimp and mix with lime juice, diced tomatoes, avocado and hot sauce. Pile generously on tostada shells. Garnish with cilantro and serve immediately.

name: Trinidadian Pork Pelau
instructions: Brown pork with sugar until caramelized. Add rice, peas, coconut milk and thyme. Cover and simmer for 30 minutes until rice is cooked.

name: Tteokbokki (Vegan)
instructions: Make spicy sauce with gochujang, gochugaru, soy sauce and sugar. Add rice cakes and cabbage. Simmer until rice cakes are soft and sauce is thick.

name: Tumbet (Vegan)
instructions: Slice and fry eggplant, potatoes and peppers separately. Layer in baking dish with tomato sauce. Bake at 350°F for 20 minutes.

name: Tuna Carpaccio
instructions: Slice tuna paper-thin and arrange on plates. Drizzle with olive oil and lemon juice. Top with arugula, parmesan shavings and capers.

name: Tuna Niçoise Salad
instructions: Grill tuna to medium-rare. Arrange with blanched beans, boiled potatoes, tomatoes, eggs, olives and anchovies. Dress with vinaigrette.

name: Tuna Tataki
instructions: Sear tuna loin on all sides for 30 seconds each. Slice thinly. Make ponzu sauce with soy, mirin, ginger and garlic. Drizzle over tuna and garnish with scallions.

name: Twice Cooked Pork
instructions: Boil pork belly until tender, slice thinly. Stir-fry with leeks and black beans, season with chili paste and soy sauce.

name: Tzatziki
instructions: Grate cucumber and squeeze out excess water. Mix with yogurt, minced garlic, dill, lemon juice and olive oil. Chill before serving.

name: Unagi Don (Grilled Eel Bowl)
instructions: Make sweet soy glaze with soy sauce, mirin and sugar. Grill eel and brush with glaze repeatedly. Slice and serve over rice with shredded nori.

name: Urap (Vegan)
instructions: Blanch vegetables. Toast grated coconut with lime leaves, sugar and tamarind. Toss vegetables with coconut mixture.

name: Vada
instructions: Soak dal and grind into thick batter. Add chilies, ginger, curry leaves and asafoetida. Form into donuts and deep-fry at 350°F until golden.

name: Vegan Burrito Bowl
instructions: Cook rice and season with lime and cilantro. Layer bowls with rice, beans, sautéed peppers, corn, avocado and salsa.

name: Vegan Chilaquiles
instructions: Simmer chips in salsa until softened but not soggy. Top with beans, vegan cheese, avocado and onions. Serve immediately.

name: Vegan Chili
instructions: Sauté onions and peppers. Add beans, tomatoes and spices. Simmer for 45 minutes until thick. Serve with cornbread.

name: Vegan Enchiladas
instructions: Dip tortillas in sauce, fill with beans and onions. Roll and place in baking dish. Top with remaining sauce and vegan cheese. Bake at 375°F for 25 minutes.

name: Vegan Fajitas
instructions: Sauté peppers, onions and mushrooms with fajita seasoning. Serve sizzling with warm tortillas, guacamole and salsa.

name: Vegan Nachos
instructions: Layer chips with beans and vegan cheese. Bake at 375°F for 10 minutes until cheese melts. Top with jalapeños, guacamole and salsa.

name: Vegan Pozole
instructions: Make red chili broth. Add hominy and simmer 30 minutes. Serve in bowls with shredded cabbage, sliced radishes, oregano and lime.

name: Vegan Quesadillas
instructions: Sauté peppers and onions. Fill tortillas with vegan cheese, vegetables and beans. Fold and cook on griddle until cheese melts and tortilla is crispy.

name: Vegan Tamales
instructions: Beat shortening with masa and broth. Spread on corn husks. Fill with vegetable mixture. Fold and steam for 1.5 hours.

name: Vegemite on Toast (Vegan)
instructions: Toast bread. Spread with vegan butter and a thin layer of vegemite. Serve for breakfast.

name: Vegetable Biryani (Vegan)
instructions: Marinate vegetables in coconut yogurt and spices. Layer par-cooked rice with vegetables, saffron milk and fried onions. Cover and cook on low heat for 30 minutes.

name: Vegetable Biryani
instructions: Marinate vegetables in yogurt and spices. Layer par-cooked rice with vegetables, saffron milk and fried onions. Cover and cook on low heat for 30 minutes.

name: Vegetable Fried Rice (Vegan)
instructions: Stir-fry vegetables with garlic. Add cold cooked rice and break up lumps. Add soy sauce and sesame oil. Toss until heated through. Garnish with scallions.

name: Vegetable Gyoza (Vegan)
instructions: Mix chopped cabbage, mushrooms, crumbled tofu, ginger, soy and sesame oil. Fill gyoza wrappers. Pan-fry until bottoms are crispy, add water and steam.

name: Vegetable Gyoza
instructions: Mix chopped cabbage, mushrooms, crumbled tofu, ginger, soy and sesame oil. Fill gyoza wrappers. Pan-fry until bottoms are crispy, add water and steam.

name: Vegetable Korma (Vegan)
instructions: Blend cashews into paste. Sauté onions and korma paste. Add vegetables, coconut yogurt and cashew paste. Simmer until vegetables are tender. Finish with coconut cream.

name: Vegetable Korma
instructions: Blend cashews into paste. Sauté onions and korma paste. Add vegetables, yogurt and cashew paste. Simmer until vegetables are tender. Finish with cream.

name: Vegetable Lo Mein (Vegan)
instructions: Cook noodles until al dente. Stir-fry vegetables with garlic. Add noodles and sauces. Toss everything over high heat until well combined.

name: Vegetable Lo Mein
instructions: Cook noodles until al dente. Stir-fry vegetables with garlic. Add noodles and sauces. Toss everything over high heat until well combined.

name: Vegetable Paella (Vegan)
instructions: Sauté vegetables. Add rice and paprika, toast briefly. Add saffron-infused stock. Cook without stirring for 20 minutes until rice forms crispy bottom layer.

name: Vegetable Paella
instructions: Sauté vegetables. Add rice and paprika, toast briefly. Add saffron-infused stock. Cook without stirring for 20 minutes until rice forms crispy bottom layer.

name: Vegetable Pakora (Vegan)
instructions: Mix flours with spices and water to make thick batter. Coat vegetable pieces in batter. Deep-fry at 350°F until golden and crispy. Serve with chutney.

name: Vegetable Pakora
instructions: Mix flours with spices and water to make thick batter. Coat vegetable pieces in batter. Deep-fry at 350°F until golden and crispy. Serve with chutney.

name: Vegetable Pulao
instructions: Toast whole spices and cumin in oil. Add vegetables and sauté. Add rice and water. Cook covered until rice is tender and fluffy, about 20 minutes.

name: Vegetable Sushi Rolls (Vegan)
instructions: Season rice with vinegar and sugar. Spread on nori, add julienned vegetables. Roll tightly with bamboo mat. Slice and serve with soy sauce and wasabi.

name: Vegetable Sushi Rolls
instructions: Season rice with vinegar and sugar. Spread on nori, add julienned vegetables. Roll tightly with bamboo mat. Slice and serve with soy sauce and wasabi.

name: Vegetable Tagine (Vegan)
instructions: Layer vegetables, chickpeas and apricots in tagine. Add ras el hanout and stock. Cook covered on low heat for 1.5 hours. Toast almonds and sprinkle on top.

name: Vegetable Tagine
instructions: Layer vegetables, chickpeas and apricots in tagine. Add ras el hanout and stock. Cook covered on low heat for 1.5 hours. Toast almonds and sprinkle on top.

name: Vegetable Tempura (Vegan)
instructions: Make light batter with flour and ice water. Dip vegetables and fry at 350°F for 2-3 minutes until crispy. Serve with tentsuyu dipping sauce.

name: Vegetable Tempura
instructions: Make light batter with flour, egg and ice water. Dip vegetables and fry at 350°F for 2-3 minutes until crispy. Serve with tentsuyu dipping sauce.

name: Vegetable Yakisoba (Vegan)
instructions: Stir-fry vegetables over high heat. Add noodles and yakisoba sauce. Toss until well coated and heated through. Top with pickled ginger and serve.

name: Vegetable Yakisoba
instructions: Stir-fry vegetables over high heat. Add noodles and yakisoba sauce. Toss until well coated and heated through. Top with pickled ginger and serve.

name: Vegetarian Burrito Bowl
instructions: Cook rice and season with lime and cilantro. Layer bowls with rice, beans, sautéed peppers, corn, cheese, avocado and sour cream.

name: Vegetarian Chilaquiles
instructions: Simmer chips in salsa until softened but not soggy. Top with fried eggs, crumbled cheese, crema and onions. Serve immediately.

name: Vegetarian Chili
instructions: Sauté onions and peppers. Add beans, tomatoes and spices. Simmer for 45 minutes until thick. Serve with sour cream and cheese.

name: Vegetarian Fajitas
instructions: Sauté peppers, onions and mushrooms with fajita seasoning. Serve sizzling with warm tortillas, cheese, sour cream and guacamole.

name: Vegetarian Larb (Vegan)
instructions: Chop mushrooms and tofu finely. Mix with lime juice, rice powder, herbs and sliced shallots. Season with chili flakes. Serve with lettuce cups.

name: Vegetarian Larb
instructions: Chop mushrooms and tofu finely. Mix with lime juice, rice powder, herbs and sliced shallots. Season with chili flakes. Serve with lettuce cups.

name: Vegetarian Nachos
instructions: Layer chips with beans and cheese. Bake at 375°F for 10 minutes until cheese melts. Top with jalapeños, sour cream, guacamole and pico de gallo.

name: Vegetarian Pozole
instructions: Make red chili broth. Add hominy and simmer 30 minutes. Serve in bowls with shredded cabbage, sliced radishes, oregano and lime.

name: Vegetarian Quesadillas
instructions: Sauté peppers and onions. Fill tortillas with cheese, vegetables and beans. Fold and cook on griddle until cheese melts and tortilla is crispy.

name: Vegetarian Tamales
instructions: Beat shortening with masa and broth. Spread on corn husks. Fill with cheese and peppers. Fold and steam for 1.5 hours.

name: Veggie Burger (Vegan)
instructions: Mash black beans and mix with cooked quinoa, breadcrumbs and onions. Form into patties. Grill or pan-fry for 4 minutes per side. Serve on buns with toppings.

name: Veggie Burger
instructions: Mash black beans and mix with cooked quinoa, breadcrumbs, egg and onions. Form into patties. Grill or pan-fry for 4 minutes per side. Serve on buns with toppings.

name: Vichyssoise (Vegan)
instructions: Sauté leeks until soft. Add potatoes and stock, simmer until tender. Blend until smooth. Stir in coconut cream. Chill and serve cold with chives.

name: Vietnamese Braised Pork with Eggs
instructions: Brown pork chunks and shallots. Add caramel sauce, fish sauce and coconut juice. Simmer with eggs for 1 hour until tender.

name: Vietnamese Crab Spring Rolls
instructions: Soften rice paper. Layer with lettuce, vermicelli, crab meat and mint. Roll tightly and serve with peanut dipping sauce.

name: Vietnamese Grilled Pork (Thit Heo Nuong)
instructions: Marinate sliced pork with minced lemongrass, fish sauce, honey, garlic and shallots for 3 hours. Grill over high heat until charred.

name: Vietnamese Lemongrass Tofu (Vegan)
instructions: Marinate tofu in minced lemongrass, garlic, soy sauce and sugar for 2 hours. Pan-fry until golden and caramelized. Serve with lime.

name: Vietnamese Pork and Cabbage Stir-Fry
instructions: Slice pork thinly and stir-fry with garlic. Add shredded cabbage and cook until wilted. Season with fish sauce and pepper.

name: Vietnamese Pork Banh Mi
instructions: Marinate and grill pork slices. Split baguettes, spread with pate and mayo. Layer with pork, pickles, cucumber and cilantro.

name: Vietnamese Pork Chops (Suon Nuong)
instructions: Marinate pork chops in minced lemongrass, fish sauce, sugar and garlic for 3 hours. Grill over high heat until caramelized.

name: Vietnamese Pork Meatballs (Nem Nuong)
instructions: Mix all ingredients and form into meatballs. Grill on skewers until caramelized and cooked through, about 12 minutes.

name: Vietnamese Pork Spring Rolls
instructions: Mix pork with soaked mushrooms, noodles and carrots. Wrap in rice paper and deep-fry until golden crispy.

name: Vietnamese Vegetable Stir-Fry (Vegan)
instructions: Stir-fry garlic. Add vegetables and cook over high heat. Season with soy sauce, sesame oil and pepper. Serve with rice.

name: Warak Enab (Stuffed Grape Leaves)
instructions: Mix rice with chopped tomatoes, herbs and oil. Wrap in grape leaves. Layer in pot with lemon juice. Simmer for 1 hour.

name: Wontons in Chili Oil (Vegan)
instructions: Chop mushrooms and cabbage finely. Mix with ginger. Fill wontons and seal. Boil until they float. Toss with chili oil, soy sauce and vinegar.

name: Yakibuta (Japanese Roast Pork)
instructions: Tie pork into a roll. Brown on all sides. Add soy, sake, mirin, ginger and garlic. Braise for 2 hours until tender. Slice thin.

name: Zaalouk (Eggplant Dip)
instructions: Roast eggplant until soft. Mash with tomatoes, garlic and spices. Cook until thick. Finish with olive oil and cilantro. Serve with bread.

name: Zaalouk (Vegan)
instructions: Roast eggplant until soft. Mash with tomatoes, garlic and spices. Cook until thick. Finish with olive oil and cilantro. Serve with bread.

name: Zarzuela de Mariscos (Seafood Stew)
instructions: Make sofrito with tomatoes and garlic. Add wine and saffron. Add seafood in order of cooking time. Thicken with ground almonds. Serve with crusty bread.
